dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits in a tree with ALPHA, her mate - large and muscu a PROMINENT WHITE BIRTHMARK ACROSS HIS SHOULDER, LIKE A SHOOTING STAR. Around them, under the TREE CANOPY, a COMMUNITY OF CHIMPANZEES naps, eats, plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOZEN POACHERS on horseback slog through the jungle. They're working towards the GROVE, visible in the distanc As they near it, the LEADER points, sending the MEN movin quietly, NETS and RIFLES ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha sits up, sensing something. BIRDS take sudden fligh He stands on the branch and YELLS OUT A WARNING. FEAR ignites the community - but too late. POACHERS BURST INTO THE CLEARING, horses' hooves kicking dirt. CHIMPS SCATTER. Bright Eyes wants to stay by Alpha's side, but he bares h teeth and sends her off. Then he drops, landing firmly on the clearing floor. All around him, POACHERS pursue terrified apes, nets swinging MALE CHIMPANZEES jump up and down, SHOUTING AND SCREECHIN an aggressive show. A futile attempt to protect the tribe Alpha zeroes in on a POACHER attempting to scoop up a YOU CHIMP. He streaks across the clearing, KNOCKS THE POACHER FROM HIS MOUNT. Alpha POUNDS his CHEST, letting out a BATTLE CRY -- tryin rally a counter-attack. But the other chimps pay no heed. There's no organization the defense. It's chaos. SHOTS RING OUT. The Chimps mauling the Poacher drop, one one. Others take off.
Alpha spots Bright Eyes across the clearing, dragged off net. He RUSHES to save her, leaps in the air... A SHOT RINGS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO WHITE
dialogues.text: TWO FACES wearing SURGICAL MASKS lean in and peer down at FRANKLIN - broken horn-rimmed glasses - and CAROLINE - cu red hair under a sterile cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanotherapy, beta version: Tuesday, March 10, 2011. Female Test subject Number four. Franklin reaches for us, smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go, Bright eyes. A MIST fogs our view for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too much. She needs to be calm, but alert.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE THROUGH INTERCOM
dialogues.text: Go ahead - send her through. A LOUD HUM and we start moving, sliding into a tunnel a tubular CT SCAN - with a MIRROR on the top. Now WE SEE OUR FACE REFLECTED: A FEMALE APE IN A GAS MASK Bright Eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL RODMAN - late twenties, lab coat over a T-shirt and jeans - stands at the glass, watching the terrified chimpanzee slide into the machine. The focus in his eyes belies the casual dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start the scan. A TECHIE sits at a computer screen beside Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scanning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another tech, DONNIE - skinny, tattooed - controls the machine, sending the restrained animal into the scanner. Caroline moves to an IV STAND beside the scan. The bag's full of a PHOSPHORESCENT GREEN LIQUID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuff looks like Kool-aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, I'm sure you could use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting the therapy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks at a monitor showing the BRAIN SCAN OF THE CHI The image starts to shake. Concerned, he looks to the oth room - where he can see the CHIMP'S LEGS SHAKING IN THEIR RESTRAINTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's convulsing. Caroline sticks a stethoscope in the tube, listens to Bri Eyes' heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please keep the monkey still. He focuses back on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not a monkey. Will looks from the monitor to Caroline. His look is intense, tough to read. She blushes slightly at the heat his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE, (INTERCOM)
dialogues.text: She's an ape. Chimpanzees, gorillas and orangutans, they're all apes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to know. Just keep it from moving. She's stung, wonders, why does he have to be such a jerk sometimes. He's oblivious to this, instead intent on getting the sca right. The green liquid moves through the chimp's neck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go. Will stares at the scan, his eyes willing the test to succeed.. .the green liquid LIGHTS UP THE CHIMP'S BRAIN. CHEER FROM THE GROUP. Will fights a CONTRACTION OF EXTREME EMOTION that passes across his face. He quickly hides it - offers up a smile the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? Caroline holds up a picture of a tree for Bright Eyes, wh sits at a table in front of a LEXIGRAM, a lit-up board wi colorful symbols. Bright Eyes presses a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: Caroline holds up a picture of an acorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this? The chimp presses another button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does the acorn come from? Bright Eyes considers... then presses a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but where does the acorn come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright Eyes interrupts, now pressing three buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acorn. Tree. Acorn. The chimp looks at Caroline, who's stunned, trying to pro the ADVANCED THINKING JUST MANIFESTED. Then she presses another button.

dialogues.speaker: ELECTRONIC VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Surprise. The unnatural voice - paired with Bright Eyes' eerily hum like gaze - is somehow CREEPY... The IMAGE FREEZES and we

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Diplomas on the wall, books everywhere. Bright Eyes looks out at Will from a computer screen. He's got two CT SCANS sitting on the desk in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We started the therapy four weeks ago. This was yesterday. Will's studying the scans. They look good. Real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been clear cell growth. Both on the frontal lobe and the neocortex. She's purposely standing close in order to point this out He notices but doesn't respond - there's history between and he's regretting that - gets in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see that. But I don't understand the primate behavioral norms. She knows an acorn's a seed. Wouldn't any monkey know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - it's conceptual. Acorn gives us a tree, which gives us an acorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abstract thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a chimpanzee. Unheard of. Will turns the possibilities over in his mind. Caroline moves away from him. He barely notices her now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're calling her a monkey just to piss me off, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start the other's on the 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And double this one's dose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will climbs into his truck. Alone, he allows his exciteme to show. Abstract thought! He pulls away from the BIO LAB, which is tucked in a corn of an old military base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will drives over the majestic Golden Gate Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pulls up in front of his house. Set in a hillside neighborhood, it's neat, nondescript. T home of a bachelor who hasn't given it much thought. As Will pulls into the driveway, WE HEAR C SHARP PLAYED O AND OVER ON A PIANO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER RODMAN, 60, sits at the piano dressed in a robe, stabbing at the key with his finger. Will enters, his posture almost visually changing with th emotional weight of this man, his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Dad. Walter looks up, whispers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John... is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As thou dost, Anthony. (staring at the keys) .he hears no music. No music...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavy Russian accent) He's been doing that all day. A Home Aide enters, grabs her coat. This is IRENA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He found an old book of his. She pulls a worn paperback of Julius Caesar from Walter's pocket. He snatches it from her, puts it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging on coat) I had no idea you liked Shakespeare so much, Mr. Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother was the one. She liked Shakespeare...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Walter, hone-ee. She heads out. Will gently takes his father's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will helps his father change into pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember I told you we were using Basic Fibroblast Growth Factors on the apes? Well the therapy seems to be working. We've seen definite signs of adult brain neurogenesis. Walter holds up his arms for Will to slide on the pajama

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Board of Directors is coming in a couple weeks to talk about Phase 2 - that's clinical trials. Walter gives no hint he's even listening, much less understanding what Will's saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Human trials, Dad. Soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I rather tell that what is to be feared than what I fear: for always... I am Caesar... There's no way to reach him tonight. Still Will tries..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to make you better - I swear it. His father looks at him. A moment of recognition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dad, it's me. Will. Will helps the old man under the bedcovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's gone. He moves to the door, pausing to take in the diplomas on walls - Walter's name on all of them. (Physics, Astronomy
Will looks at his father lying there on his back, staring at the ceiling. The once brilliant man now slipping away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late. Signs of a half-eaten frozen dinner on the des beside numerous papers, charts, and Will's computer. He looks exhausted, gulps from a cup of coffee as he work

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franklin moves from cage to cage, greeting the apes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Felix. Bam Bam. Monty. Hey - what's the matter, don't like my cooking?

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: He pauses in front of Bright Eyes, huddled at the back of cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong with Bright Eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll check on her when we're done. Franklin unlocks a cage and leads a CHIMP - LUCKY - into next room, where Caroline waits beside the CT scanner. Lucky's head is shaved, exposing a long, curving scar on cranium. From Bright Eyes' vantage point she can see through the o door as Lucky's strapped down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will - dressed in an ill-fitting suit off the rack, hair brushed in an attempt at neatness - meets STEVEN JACOBS a steps from a beautiful BLACK JAGUAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could at least try to look excited. 0
Will's too nervous to look excited. He eyes the FOUR SUIT disembarking from nearby TOWN CARS. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not good with this stuff. Jacobs puts a hand on Will's back, leads him inside. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do fine. Just speak English. Keep the science simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the back of her cage, Bright Eyes watches through th open door as the ape on the table convulses. CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Back it out... DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your turn. Bright Eyes RUSHES FORWARD, HER HANDS GRIPPING THE BARS S DONNIE CAN'T OPEN THE CAGE. DONNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon - Let go - She understands what he wants but she won't do it. THAT'S WHEN HE NOTICES: HER HANDS ARE BLOODY. DONNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Something's wrong with number four! Franklin looks over - he's still dealing with Lucky on th table... FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right over - Donnie looks closely at Bright Eyes. There's something different in her face today. Rage? Force of will? DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stands at the head of a table. A BIG PLASMA SCREEN behind him shows a BLOW UP OF A BRAIN SCAN. As Will speak he gestures at it with a LASER POINTER.
WILL 0 (AWKWARD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alzheimer's affects the entire neocortex, the hippocampus, and large subcortical regions of the brain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie and Bright Eyes are at a standoff. Once more he tr to open the cage, once more she yanks it shut. Again he tries... and is taken by surprise when SHE GRABS HAND AND PULLS IT THROUGH THE BARS. DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!!! Now Donnie's smashed up against the bars. Hard. The other apes begin to SCREECH. Donnie hasn't panicked quite yet, but he's about to. DONNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone get her off of me! CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on - Franklin struggles to hold onto Lucky as Caroline hurries over. He eyes the chimps in their cages - GOING CRAZY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will continues his presentation. Stevens looks around at board members - they're lost. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the past, it's been impossible to target specific areas, both because of the Blood Brain Barrier - Jacobs stands, interrupting Will. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Dr. Rodman has done is to invent a virus that can, for the first time, cross the membrane that protects the brain and deliver a genetic, therapeutic, payload. 0
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to sell) This 'payload' would directly affect the areas of memory, higher function - and, of course, the motherlode: intelligence. The board members stare, trying to comprehend. BOARD MEMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning. (deep breath here) If Phase 2 goes as planned, we're looking at a cure for Alzheimer's. With an elbow prompting from Jacobs, Will takes a SAMPLE from his jacket pocket and awkwardly holds it up for dram effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's breaking my hand! CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go, Bright Eyes! You're hurting him! She tries to help pull Donnie away. CAROLINE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go! In the next room Franklin's having troubles of his own.

dialogues.speaker: HE CRASHES OUT OF THE LAB, DRAGGING HIS LEASH.
dialogues.text: FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky no! Stop! (TO CAROLINE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit the alarm! Caroline lunges to an ALARM BUTTON and pounds it. DONNIE'S SCREAMS BECOME OTHERWORLDLY AS WE GO TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUD BEEPING as two GUARDS look to a BLACK AND WHITE SCRE of a corridor. They see Lucky dragging his leash as he scampers - unattended - down the hall. GUARD #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh. Guard #2 turns to another screen - where DONNIE IS VISIBL

dialogues.speaker: GET HIM FREE.
dialogues.text: GUARD #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Len...? Bright eyes is pulling Donnie's arm right from its socket Donnie falls to the floor at Caroline's feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky BURSTS from the lab building and runs across the grounds. He leaps over a car, then heads for the nearest building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is still thrumming with the excitement of Will's pronouncement. BOARD MEMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the safety of the virus? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfectly safe. We're using the most stable - A COMMOTION outside. Someone SCREAMS. Then a BLACK BLUR as LUCKY CRASHES THROUGH THE GLASS WIND WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Lucky turns on Will with a growl, lurching toward him and pinning him to the wall. It happens fast. The chimpanzee opens his powerful jaw, exposing DEADLY INCISORS... ГўВЂВў BAM! BAM! BAM! Security Guard #1 SHOOTS LUCKY IN T The chimp turns, leaps for the Guard - who FIRES again.
Will watches as the chimp - and all of Will's dreams - collapses on the boardroom table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain and fog. An AMBULANCE pulls out, past POLICE CRUISER and two CDC (CENTER FOR DISEASE CONTROL) VANS. Will - face cut, clothing torn - finishes with a DETECTIV and walks through the chaotic aftermath. He watches Carol walk alongside a stretcher carrying Donnie, his shoulder packed in ice. He spots Jacobs, who looks wrecked. He hurries over to hi WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they gone? JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long gone. Will knows the answer, but has to ask anyway. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they say anything before they left? I mean, about Phase 2. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look around you, for Christ sakes. We'll be lucky if we don't go to jail. Will's gutted - devastated. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're so close. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're the only one who's got something at stake here? I've got my own skin in this game! WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened had nothing to do with the 112. (desperate to clarify) Take an already aggressive animal, make it smarter - you're going to get a potentially dangerous SITUATION -
JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you so damned positive about that? (pauses for emphasis) What if this drug does things you don't understand? Are you going to take responsibility for that? Because I'm sure as hell not going to. Here Will hesitates. JACOBS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not ready for human trials. Hell, we weren't ready for monkey trials. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're apes. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what we're going to do: You're taking a sabbatical. I'll let the board handle the lawsuit. When this blows over I'll bring you back and we'll start over - we'll do it right this time. With mice. Tiny mice that can't hurt anybody. Will finds to his dismay that he's got nothing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stands at the fringes of the room, watching MEN IN HAZMAT SUITS pull down SHELVES OF METAL CANISTERS LABELED 112. His work - destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will climbs into his truck and pauses. He reaches into a jacket pocket and brings out a VIAL - IT'S THE VIAL of 11 USED IN THE PRESENTATION - THE ONLY REMAINING ONE. TAP AT THE WINDOW. Franklin's face appears. Will shoves the VIAL back into his pocket, rolls down the window. Г‚ВЂВў FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show you something, boss?
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't work here anymore, Franklin. FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just put down fifteen animals, Dr. Rodman. The least you could do is give me a moment of your time. Will's shoulders sag with exhaustion. It's been a long, devastating day. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cages are empty, the doors open. Will notes used SYRINGES on the table, filled body bags lined up on the floor. It's a creepy, horrible scene. FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all gone. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Franklin. Genuinely sorry... What's he got to do to get the hell out of there? Franklin ignores him, steps inside Bright Eyes' cage. He moves to the very back and pulls aside a blanket. At first Will doesn't understand what he's looking at. Th lighting's dim and the thing's so small... But then IT MOVES AND WILL REALIZES HE'S LOOKING AT AN IN CHIMPANZEE. Will stares at it for a long moment, his brain overloaded WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's impossible. How could a full- term gestation go unnoticed? FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They carry small. Must have been pregnant when they brought her in. Will tries to get his mind around the situation.
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else knows about this? FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd bring him home, but my brother- in-law works for security. He'd rat me out in a second. That's when will realizes. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to take him? FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an orphan now. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be thrown in jail. He's a chimpanzee who's been exposed to a possibly dangerous drug. FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe that. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter what I believe. FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for a couple days. Until I can find a sanctuary. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not possible. FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you outside, fighting to keep them alive. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was talking about the work, my RESEARCH - FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she was just trying to protect him. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? 0
FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright Eyes - the mother. That's why she wouldn't let anyone into her cage. Will looks down at the helpless baby. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Franklin - I'm sorry - but there's nothing I can do here. He's got to be put down like the others. FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, Doc. (producing a syringe) I'm done for the day. So you be my guest. Franklin hands the LONG NEEDLE to Will. It's quiet. Will can hear the baby's WHEEZY breath. He enters the cage kneels beside it, regards his tiny body, little hands. Will readies the needle, brings it close to the chimp's belly... but there's no way he can go through with this. Angrily Will tosses the needle aside. Turns to Franklin, watches from outside the cage. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days. Then you have to figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOX OF DIAPERS pulled from the shelf and tossed into a cart. Will moves down the aisle in a daze, the baby chimp - cov in a blanket - plastered to his chest. He stops at the powdered formulas, overwhelmed by the arr of choices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TEEN rings up the baby goods. TEEN CASHIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man. Congratulations.
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? (REALIZING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pulls up in his truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's coat is pulled forward to shield the baby at his chest. He barely has the key in the lock when Irena opens the door. IRENA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Friday night. I had a date. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry - there was - She doesn't wait to hear his excuse, just moves down the walk, her footfalls pointed and angry. He pauses there. Apparently no end to this bad day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will dumps the baby goods on the counter, heads for the refrigerator. The infant's still plastered to his chest. He opens the fridge, grabs a crisper drawer, empties its contents in the sink. Then Will REACHES INTO HIS JACKET POCKET AND TAKES OUT TH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sleeps the deep sleep of exhaustion. A HIGH PITCHED WAIL comes from another part of the house. Will sits up, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will enters, half asleep, turns on the light. The baby ch lies in a cardboard box on the floor and he's obviously s making UNNATURAL WHEEZING NOISES. 0
Will stares down at the little creature, trying to decide what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns on the HOT WATER. SHUTS the door. Holding the limp, feeble chimp in his arms, he puts down the toilet s and sits. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's going to be okay. Awkwardly, he even rocks back and forth a little bit. Will looks down at the chimp, struggling for breath. The room fills with STEAM. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LARGE MALE CHIMPANZEE IN THE WILD. He stands at the top a tree, an alpha male, eyeing the CHIMPS around him. In a sudden BURST of movement, the CHIMPANZEE TAKES OFF, FLYING FROM BRANCH TO BRANCH with tremendous force, a FRE TRAIN OF THREAT, POWER AND VIOLENCE. Teeth bared in a terrifying display, the ape easily intimidates all the chimps around him.

dialogues.speaker: THEM ON HIS LAPTOP.
dialogues.text: Abruptly he closes it. Looks down at the infant, so peace in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: SOUND of a TOILET FLUSH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chimp - looking like a toddler - walks out of the bathroom, hiking up a pair of shorts. WE FOLLOW HIM THROU THE HOUSE as he zig zags up and over furniture. The house looks warmer, cluttered, more lived-in. The chimp arrives at a hallway, where he leaps into the a and grabs hold of a CORD that hangs from the ceiling. As his weight pulls it down, there's a SQUEAK and a FOLD LADDER opens from above. WE FOLLOW HIM up the ladder into

ГўВЂВўINT. ATTIC -- DAY .the attic. Beams of light streaming through a LARGE VENT TO THE OUTSIDE. Rings and pegs for climbing are set into walls. Toys, books and puzzles scattered across the floor SOUNDS of KIDS PLAYING and LAUGHING OUTSIDE. The chimp heads for the vent and peers through. WE GO OVE HIS SHOULDER TO SEE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From up here, the chimp has a commanding view of the enti neighborhood. A group of CHILDREN rides bikes. A MAN mows his lawn. There's a HONK below, and the chimp watches as a TAXI pul up to the HOUSE NEXT DOOR. HUNSIKER - A MAN in an AIRLINE PILOT uniform - kisses his WIFE and young DAUGHTER, ALICE, then climbs into the cab his carry-on suitcase. Alice clutches a doll in her hand as she watches her dadd Taxi disappear around the corner... Then TODD, the big brother, SWIPES THE DOLL FROM HER HAND and rides off on h bike. His FRIENDS LAUGH. The chimp watches, riveted, as the Alice BURSTS INTO OUTR TEARS and runs after them.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Caesar! Breakfast! The chimp turns at Will's call. HIS NAME IS CAESAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will comes away from the ladder, heads for the kitchen. The living room floor is strewn with puzzles and games. O of them has been completed. Will considers it, looks arou for the box, reads the side... AGES 12 and up. 12 and up. Caesar runs past, jumps onto d chair at the kitchen table picks up a fork and starts eating his eggs and potatoes. Will walks over, sits across from him. 0
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please pass the ketchup. Caesar slides the ketchup to Will. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (using American Sign LANGUAGE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. NOTE: Whenever Caesar communicates he's signing and there will be subtitles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOUSE moves through a maze as a LAB TECH marks its progress. Will - in a lab coat - watches with intensity. The mouse moves effortlessly through the maze until it reaches an ORANGE CONE at a crossroads. The mouse stops, studies the cone. LAB TECH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he going to turn left or right...? The mouse turns left at the cone - and finds his way to a piece of cheese. Will does his best to hide the excitemen blooming on his face. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is. Restored cognitive function. LAB TECH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same success rate as the primates. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VISITORS buy tickets at the entrance gates. Will pulls around to an Employee Parking Lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Molly Stewart - late 20's, pretty tomboy -- finishes taking Caesar's blood pressure.
Г‚ВЂВў STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right on target. Height. Weight... She checks Caesar's ears. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dairy Queen. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After. Sit still. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about diet? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A healthy diet. Fruits, vegetables. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice cream. Will ignores him. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he saying? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hungry. Caesar's angling to climb off the examining table. Will sends him a look - out it out. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems extremely intelligent. How many words does Caesar sign? Beat. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, the basics. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soft-serve. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard of apes learning up to a hundred and fifty words. Is he good with puzzles? Will hesitates. 0
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's pretty good. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Caesar's healthy, obviously happy. You're doing a great job with him. (doesn't want to alarm) But there is an anomaly I noticed. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what? STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was examining his eyes, I noticed a strange green pigmentation. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green? His heart starts to pound. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green. Never.seen it before. She hands Will an OTOSCOPE. STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look. Will peers through the magnification - and sure enough, f FLECKS OF BRIGHT GREEN PIGMENTATION - JUST LIKE THE 112. STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's faint, can you pick it up? He sits down in the nearest chair - stunned. She eyes him STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright? Want a glass of water? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. (EMBARRASSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, that would be good. She gets him one. Concerned, Caesar comes over. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgot to eat today. Not a big deal.
Stewart hands him the glass. He downs it. WILL (CONT'D) (TO CAESAR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Stewart puts her hand to the side of his neck. Feels good STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carotid pulse is running a little fast. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a human or a chimpanzee? First time he's seen her smile. It lights up her face. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta remember to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will drives Caesar, both of them licking soft-serve ice c cones. He pulls up outside a store: "SMART CHILD" EDUCATIONAL TESTING TOYS.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You have to move the whole tower to another peg, one block at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's parked in front of the TV, not watching it. Caesar sits at the table looking at a flat board with thr wooden poles. There are four colored blocks threaded on t first pole, stacked biggest to smallest, making a 'tower' Irena stands next to Will, watching Caesar. There's also CAMCORDER on a tripod. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the hard part: you can't put a larger block on top of a smaller one. Caesar studies the puzzle. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understand?

Caesar's already started. He methodically begins moving blocks from one pole to another, pausing, backtracking, getting it right, never a bigger one on top of a smaller. Will watches, increasingly amazed, as he re-creates the t on a different pole. It's easy for him. Finished, Caesar looks up at him. Will fumbles in his pocket, HANDS CAESAR SOME M&MS. WILL (CONT'D) (STUNNED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did it in fifteen moves. IRENA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the best score? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen. Will looks over at Walter, who's staring at the wall. IRENA (AMAZED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder where he gets such talent? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes on Walter) It was passed down from his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will uploads the MPEG video of Caesar doing the puzzle an prepares to record an AUDIO ATTACHMENT. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into computer mic) At age two Caesar appears to exceed his mother's aptitude. He signs over three hundred words. He exhibits no visible side effects from the therapy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will flips on a light. Enters. Closes the door behind him Taking a key from his pocket he approaches a SMALL, PADLO REFRIGERATOR and unlocks it. Opens the door. Inside-WE SEE: THE SINGLE VIAL OF ADV 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sits on the edge of the sofa, the VIAL of 112 in his hand. He's deep in agonized thought. Finally he takes a SYRINGE and FILLS IT WITH THE GREEN LIQUID. Then he stands, walks to a closed door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The opening door sends a wash of light into the dark room Walter's in bed. He opens his eyes, squinting at the brightness. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (syringe in hand) Dad. I've got something that's going to make you better. Will closes the door behind him. WE HEAR A RHYTHMIC SQUEAKING NOISE as we... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The movement of a SWING. Caesar's strapped in it, and WE NOTICE IMMEDIATELY THAT HE'S GROWN OLDER.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: Caesar's features are more mature. He appears more like a "little boy" - and his EYES HAVE TURNED A DEEP GREEN. Back and forth Caesar goes, as high as he can manage. At the height of his forward motion, he peers down into t neighbor's yard where, for just an instant, HE CAN SEE TO PLAYING BALL WITH ALICE AND ANOTHER KID. At the height of his backward motion he catches another glimpse. Caesar pumps his legs, eager to get a better look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's making sandwiches, his eye on Caesar through the window. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to someone offscreen) You want turkey or ham?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ham!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE FIND WALTER just sitting down on the piano bench. He begins playing a competent version of "CLAIR DE LUNE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pauses, listening to the MUSIC. He moves to the door to watch his father. The happiness - the relief - is clear on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SQUEAK.SQUEAK of the SWING, the PIANO FAINT from out here Caesar studies the harness that's keeping him in the swin There's a clamp on either side and a clamp on the back. H undoes the one on his right side. CLICK. Then the left side. CLICK. Caesar wriggles the harness around so that he can reach t clamp on his back with his long chimpanzee arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will returns to his sandwich making. It takes him a momen to notice that CAESAR HAS DISAPPEARED FROM THE SWING. The color drains from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar stands at the edge of the yard, unsure what to do next. All three kids - Todd, Alice and Todd's buddy - hav stopped playing to stare at him. Caesar spots a BALL lying on the grass. He picks it up an tosses it to Todd's Buddy. The Boy catches it, throws it back to Caesar. TODD'S BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it. He wants to play. Thrilled at the contact, Caesar throws the ball to Todd. Todd has an idea, and the idea makes him smile. Alice doesn't have a good feeling. She watches as her brother throws the ball to his Buddy OVER CAESAR'S HEAD.
TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monkey in the middle. Todd's Buddy LAUGHS. Caesar LAUGHS too, although he's not sure what's funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Walter walk down the street looking for Caesar. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar! WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't go far. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd and his buddy throw the ball over Caesar's head, whi Caesar jumps to try and catch it.

dialogues.speaker: TODD AND FRIEND
dialogues.text: Monkey in the middle, monkey in the middle... Caesar's having fun, unaware that the game has become kee away from him. Until he NOTICES ALICE'S EXPRESSION - SHE FEELS SORRY FOR HIM.

dialogues.speaker: GOING ON
dialogues.text: They're making fun of him. "MONKEY", "MONKEY", "MONKEY"... The chanted words ring in Caesar's ears. He drops his arms and walks over to Todd, stepping close, hot rage escaping from his nostrils. Todd tries to laugh it off, but the fear's plain on his f Alice runs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Walter search down the street. Then they hear it ГўВЂВў HUNSIKER'S YELL. Will runs for the neighbor's hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunsiker approaches Caesar with a raised bat. The terrifi chimp backs toward his fence. HUNSIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah! Hah - Will JUMPS INTO THE YARD AND PUTS HIMSELF BETWEEN HUNSIKE AND CAESAR. Caesar cowers behind him. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on - it's okay - he's harmless! HUNSIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your monkey came onto my property! Threatened my kids! By now Caesar has climbed into Will's arms, burying his h in. his neck. Will backs toward the gate. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't happen again... HUNSIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right it won't happen again! I'll press charges if it does! Will holds Caesar close and hurries home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he do for fun? Will's brought Caesar in for a check-up. He's a little thrown by the question. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we've got puzzles, games, a swing set... STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guess is he needs more. More exercise, more space. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll work on that. Stewart continues examining Caesar. Will watches her list to his heart. Closing her eyes for a moment, listening.
He gets up his nerve. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do for fun? She opens her eyes, looks at him. He thinks she doesn't understand the question. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about dinner and a movie? Stewart pulls the stethoscope from her ears. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, did you say something? He starts to try again - but the moment's gone. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - nothing. Caesar meets Will's eyes, obviously disappointed. Stewart lingers a moment, certain she's missed something but Will doesn't say more.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: From high above, WE PASS OVER the Golden Gate Bridge, the link between the bustling city and a huge, green FOREST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar - driving with Walter and Will -- looks out the wi extremely excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Caesar scrambles out of the truck, WILL HOOKS A HARNES TO HIS COLLAR and helps Walter from the car. The chimp looks around at the SOARING TREES. What is this place? The three of them head into the forest, Caesar tugging at the leash. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him off the leash. Г‚ВЂВў WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a place up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've walked deep into the park. No people here. Will kneels next to Caesar. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go far. Stay where I can see you. Will takes OFF CAESAR'S HARNESS. The chimpanzee runs, beg flying from tree to tree. Will watches, nervous. But it's gratifying to see Caesar so happy. The CHIMP DISAPPEARS around a corner. A moment passes, th another. The men follow... and discover CAESAR STANDING I GROVE OF TREES. WILL (CONT'D) (YELLING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember - stay where I can see you - if you got lost in these woods I'd never find you.

dialogues.speaker: A CANOPY OVERHEAD.
dialogues.text: WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Climb! The men sit down on a log, watching as Caesar swings from branches. Free, elated. An animal in his element. Caesar begins climbing a redwood. Our view of him is obscured by the leaves. As his dark form ascends, Will an Walter become smaller and smaller down below.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: RUSTLING LEAVES whisper Caesar upward. He moves with an e grace, exhilarated by the freedom. At the TOP of the giant redwood CAESAR EMERGES THROUGH TH

dialogues.speaker: GREEN, FEATURES SOMEWHAT LESS SIMIAN, PERHAPS MORE HUMAN.
dialogues.text: Caesar looks across the bay to San Francisco, looks north the mountains. Then down to Will below. Will's pointing to his watch.
ГўВЂВў CLOSE ON A HARNESS. Will has it waiting as Caesar beside him on the forest floor. Will attaches the harness and they walk together. Caesar' much taller now - over five feet. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to rush you - got to get home and check on Walter. They approach a WOMAN with a LARGE DOG on a leash - a GRE DANE. The dog BARKS, lunging menacingly. The Woman struggles to control him. WOMAN (INCREDULOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a chimpanzee? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry - he's harmless. Very sweet. The big dog keeps BARKING. Annoyed, Caesar finally turns and gives him a LARGE, CHIMPANZEE SNARL, BARING HIS TEETH. The Great Dane immediately WHIMPERS - terrified - and pul the Woman away. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess he had it coming. Caesar watches as the Woman walks off with the dog, HIS G LINGERING ON THE LEASH. THEN HIS EYES MOVE TO HIS OWN LEASH. Is he a pet too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will drives up, Caesar in tow. The ZOO'S BEING RENOVATED machinery everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will leads Caesar inside the examination room - and finds himself face to face with a YOUNG MALE VETERINARIAN. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dr. Stewart? S VETERINARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't work here anymore.
Doesn't work here anymore? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where she went? VETERINARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry - I don't. Will's deeply disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disoriented because of the construction, Will makes a wro turn as he leads Caesar to the car. They find themselves in front of THE PRIMATE ENCLOSURE. Caesar goes rigid, staring at a DOZEN CHIMPS in the branc of the trees - behind bars. They stare back at him. One CHIMP, a GRIZZLED OLD MALE, STEPS FORWARD - OMINOUS. HE LOOKS AT CAESAR AS IF LOOKING INTO HIS SOUL. Caesar's transfixed. Will looks back and forth between the chimps and Caesar. Neither makes a sound. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. As Will drags Caesar off, the apes in the enclosure climb higher in the tree to watch. Suddenly they ALL BEGIN TO SCREAM IN A DEAFENING CHATTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar stands at the vent watching the neighborhood TEENA walk home from school. One BOY walks with a blonde teenage GIRL, books clutched her chest. Caesar watches the Boy flirt with her. The gir smiles, flirts back. One of the younger Kids runs by, bopping the Boy on the h The BOY SHOOTS HIM THE FINGER and returns to the girl. Caesar's fascinated by these antics. He wants to be with these teens. He wants to be one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar stands in front of a FULL LENGTH MIRROR, shirtless He stands up straight, like a human. Tries to imitate the posture, their gait.

dialogues.speaker: LIKE ALPHA'S.
dialogues.text: He runs two fingers down the length of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, Walter and Will sit at the dinner table. There's tension here, but we can't place it yet. Then WE SEE that WALTER IS STRUGGLING TO EAT BECAUSE HE'S USING THE WRONG END OF THE SPOON. He clutches the utensil staring at it. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it around, Dad. You're using the wrong end. Walter looks at Will, uncomprehending. With care and compassion, Caesar reaches over and helps t old man, adjusting the spoon. Will watches. Heartbroken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOUSE runs through a MAZE. It reaches a fork in the pat leading to two different plastic objects, one green, one orange. The mouse hesitates, confused. He backs away from the cone. A LAB TECH makes a note. Will and Jacobs stand behind him reading the number results on a monitor. Will's obviously discouraged. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drug's not staying ahead of the disease. 0
JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're still making progress, right? Will tries to tamp down the frustration he's sure is writ all over his face. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. At this pace we'll get to trials by the time Hell freezes over. Jacobs - embarrassed in front of the Tech - pulls him asi JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't graduate school - there's a procedure we have to adhere to. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll take forever. I need to start developing a primate version now. Jacobs looks at Will. He's known him a long time. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your father? Haven't seen him in a while. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't about him. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's worse, isn't he? Will wants to tell Jacobs the truth - he's tempted to tel him about Caesar, about Walter's treatment - but he can't WILL (EVASIVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine. WE HEAR A PERSISTENT C SHARP COMING FROM A DISTANT PIANO. It's a familiar, baleful SOUND that continues over the following...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sits in front of the computer, looking at a file cra with MPEGs of Caesar doing puzzles and games.
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into computer mic) Caesar continues to maintain a high level of cognition. But Walter's disease has caught up to the neurogenesis treatment. Nearly all initial improvement has been erased... Will stops recording. KICKS his desk in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits at the piano, hitting his one note. Caesar passes him, heads for Will's study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar enters, finds Will at the desk, head in hands. Wil senses his presence. Looks up. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who Caesar. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who. With effort, Will pulls himself from his own thoughts and tries to understand what Caesar wants from him. CAESAR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar is an ape. (SIGNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chimpanzee. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No "what". "Who". Will is taken aback - beginning to realize the intellectu leap Caesar's taken. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you asking about your identity? That's abstract thought, Caesar. Caesar couldn't care less about 'abstract thought.'
CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Will father. Will Caesar father? Will looks at the chimp - sees the intensity, the pain on face. How to begin to answer?

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: This is where you were born. It's the place where I work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Caesar are PARKED ACROSS THE STREET FROM THE GEN LAB GROUNDS, its buildings visible through the fencing. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never knew your father, but your mother came to live here. This is where you were born. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar mother? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was very very smart. And she passed that onto you through her blood. Caesar strains for a better view. Undoes his seatbelt. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar go. Caesar see. Will locks the car door. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not here anymore. I'm sorry, Caesar - she died. That's when I brought you home to live with me and Walter. Caesar's getting worked up - he wants out of the car. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar mother... Will grows concerned. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. This is a bad place for you, Caesar. We're going to go now.
As Will pulls away Caesar strains for a last glimpse, twisting around to look out the back window.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Let's see if we can find something for you on the TV...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter has a new HOME AIDE - a pale, hard-looking older woman. He sits on the sofa staring at the TV's moving ima as she changes channels. The Aide settles on a news show covering preparations for SPACE LAUNCH. ASTRONAUTS wave to the PRESS CORPS as they board a SHUTTLE. TV REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Icarus crew is led by Commander Colonel George Taylor. This is his fifth space mission...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a crude drawing of an ape. Caesar sits on the floor, working on its details. As he draws the white birthmark - like a falling star - WE REALIZE it's a self- portrait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Home Aide lights herself a cigarette, sits down on a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV's still blaring, but the sofa's empty. REVEAL Walter, standing in the middle of the room, confus As if he's not sure where he is. Abruptly he turns and heads across the room... and OUT TH FRONT DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter pauses on the porch, blinking in the sun. The stre ahead of him is quiet. No one around. Walter wanders down the front path. When he arrives at th sidewalk he keeps on going, STEPPING OUT INTO THE STREET. 0
He's immediately startled by a SUDDEN HONK, the SOUND of SQUEALING BRAKES, and a car fishtailing out of control. T car SMASHES into a nearby tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing the CRASH, Caesar jumps to his feet, rushes to th vent. He sees Hunsiker emerge from the smashed car, unhur Caesar watches as Hunsiker inspects the ruined front fend then turns to YELL at someone. That's when Walter comes into Caesar's view. He's in the street, afraid, disoriented - while Hunsiker rages, jabbing a threatening finger towards Walter's ches In a flash Caesar's down the attic stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter backs up as Hunsiker approaches, still jabbing the menacing finger. HUNSIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the front of my car you stupid, stupid old man! You should be locked up! Your son's going to pay for that damage - CAESAR EXPLODES OUT THE DOOR. No time for anybody to react. The chimpanzee BODY SLAMS HUNSIKER to the ground. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar... Straddling Hunsiker, teeth bared, Caesar pounds him with fists. HUNSIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Get him off - WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar... no... Stop! Walter grabs Caesar by the shoulders, tries to pull him b But Caesar's too carried away by his rage - he shrugs the man off his back. Then he grabs one of Hunsiker's hands and BITES OFF THE "JABBING" POINTER FINGER.
HUNSIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaaah! Walter struggles to his feet and grabs Caesar again. A PU OF HUNSIKER'S BLOOD STREAKS ACROSS HIS NECK. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar! Caesar hesitates. Blood dripping down his chin, he looks over his shoulder and meets Walter's eyes. WALTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stop. Hunsiker uses the distraction. He scrabbles to his feet a sprints for his house.

dialogues.speaker: TOO BIG TO FIGHT.
dialogues.text: He races after Hunsiker. WALTER FALLS TO THE GROUND. HIS HEAD HITS THE PAVEMENT, stunning him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Hunsiker's about to reach his front door, Caesar flies from behind - his feet hitting the door - and lands block Hunsiker's entrance. White with terror, Hunsiker - clutching his bleeding hand his chest - takes off running down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunsiker runs for his life. He looks over his shoulder - Caesar's galloping behind, in hot pursuit. He tries to speed up - can't go any faster. Again he glan over his shoulder - Caesar's closing in. Breath coming hard, Hunsiker sprints, scrambles, desperat escape. He looks over his shoulder-but this time CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: HAS DISAPPEARED. HE'S NOT ANYWHERE, UP OR DOWN THE STREET
dialogues.text: Unsure where to go, half-stumbling, Hunsiker keeps runnin Then, OUT OF NOWHERE, CAESAR SWINGS DOWN FROM A TREE. HE LANDS SQUARELY IN FRONT OF HUNSIKER, BLOCKING HIS PATH. Hunsiker backs up, changes direction, runs across the str 0

Enjoying the chase, taking his time, Caesar grabs a tree branch and swings from tree to tree. with one giant jump, he makes it to the top of a tree acr the street, tracking Hunsiker like prey. Hunsiker's running out of steam. Caesar swings down in fr of him and KICKS him in the chest, sending him flying. Calmly he stands over Hunsiker, who cowers. HUNSIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please no... Caesar pounds his chest, YELLING in triumph. But then he sees something across the street that abruptl pulls him out of his euphoria: WALTER - STRUGGLING, BLOOD BEING HELPED TO HIS FEET. He looks down at Hunsiker, cringing. All at once CAESAR REALIZES WHAT HE'S DONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's car drives down a two-lane highway.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: .chimpanzee named Caesar, terrorizing the quiet family enclave and mauling neighbor Douglas Hunsiker, a pilot for Global Airlines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacobs watches the evening NEWS. REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defense claimed the chimp was merely trying to protect its owner from perceived aggression. FOOTAGE OF WILL LEAVING A COURTHOUSE, avoiding News Crews Jacobs sits forward, turns up the volume. REPORTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chimpanzee's distraught owner, Wilson Rodman, has raised the animal since he was an infant. (MORE)
REPORTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pleaded to keep Caesar at home, citing the ape's remarkable intelligence. Will and a chimpanzee? Jacobs stares at the TV, dumbfound INT. MOVING CAR Г‚В»- DAY Will and Caesar drive. Caesar's dressed up - khaki pants a Polo shirt. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're visiting a place called "The Ranch". They have animals. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real animals? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. Apes. Chimpanzees, gorillas, orangutans... Caesar GRUNTS, excited. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be good. You'll like it very much. Caesar looks at Will, picking up on something. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sad? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No, I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Will pulls into the entrance, Caesar's glued to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull into a CLEARING. Ahead is a new world - CONCRET AND STEEL BUILDINGS set incongruously into the bucolic countryside. A HOUSE/OFFICE, a LIVING QUARTERS, a HORSE PADDOCK - all cold, efficient structures. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where animals?
Will sees the PRIMATE CAGES in the distance, next to a GI RED METAL ATRIUM. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, I think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they climb from the car, MR. LANDON, 50's, emerges fro the office. DODGE, 20's, hangs back. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be Mr. Landon. (SHAKING HANDS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LANDON
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Caesar. This is Dodge, helps me run the place. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been telling Caesar about the animals you have here. How much fun it is.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LANDON
dialogues.text: Yes, we have a big play center where the chimpanzees like to climb. (TO CAESAR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to see the play center? Caesar nods. Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE CAGED STRUCTURE, the size of a gymnasium. Inside a climbing constructions, ropes, toys, and, in the middle, LARGE TREE, reaching up through the top bars. A CAGED-IN BRIDGE leads to a row of DARK DENS. But for now... it's empty. No apes in sight. Caesar approaches with will and Mr. Landon.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LANDON
dialogues.text: What do you think, Caesar? Want to give it a try? Trying to mask his growing dread, Will removes Caesar's harness.
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. He watches Caesar - unsuspecting - move through AN OPEN, LIKE SLIDING DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar scampers up the ledges and leaps to a bar. He swin from bar to bar, then hits the ground and runs for the tr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will can barely watch AS DODGE ROLLS THE SLIDING DOOR CLO LOCKING IT. He braces himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar joyfully climbs the sprawling tree until he HITS T TOP OF THE CAGE. Branches continue through spaces in the bars, but HE'S REACHED... A DEAD END. CAESAR TURNS, FINDS WILL'BELOW. What he reads in Will's e gives him a sudden, sharp sense of dread.

dialogues.speaker: HE'S LOCKED IN. TRAPPED.
dialogues.text: Caesar SHRIEKS, speeds down the tree. Other SHRIEKS join in. EXCITED APE NOISES - coming from UNSEEN, CAGED APES - fills the atrium. The STRANGE ANIMAL VOICES FUEL CAESAR'S PANIC. He runs to the gate, tries to shake it open. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Caesar. It's going to be okay... The words are for him as much as Caesar. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to live here for a while. This is what the Judge says we have to do. 0

WHAT? Caesar can't believe what he's hearing! He frantically signs, desperate, pleading. The SHRIEKS of the UNSEEN APES continue, feeding Will's apprehension. Caesar doesn't belong here. It takes every bit of restraint he has not to take Caesar out, to run... WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll take good care of you here. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's about it for visiting hours. Will shoots him a look of daggers.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LANDON
dialogues.text: What Dodge means is, in our experience, longer you drag out the leave-taking, harder it is. On both of you. Caesar WHIMPERS, tries to bend the bars apart. When this doesn't work, he tries prying them open with his teeth. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to trick you this way, but you would never have agreed. I was afraid they'd hurt you if they forced you -

dialogues.speaker: MR. LANDON
dialogues.text: He'll be fine. Will gives Caesar a last, long look. The pain in his eyes matched only by Caesar's. WE STAY WITH CAESAR as Will forces himself to walk away. Caesar's SHRIEKS build. The SURROUNDING APES chime in...a CACOPHONY OF PRIMAL ENERGY. CAESAR HURTLES HIS BODY AGAINST THE CAGE. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar. Hey. I can get you out. Dodge stands at the end of the atrium, BECKONING. DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

Caesar follows Dodge to the far end of the play area, the through the CAGED-IN BRIDGE. Will's almost out of sight. Caesar can see that he's nearly reached the car. He GRUNTS with stress as he follows the bridge into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .the Chimpanzee House - and stops in his tracks. This is the source of the APE NOISE. It has an open, indo area in the center, bordered by cages of CHIMPANZEES. Caesar's TAKEN ABACK BY THE LOUD, DARK FORMS POUNDING ARO THEIR CAGES. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar - over here. Dodge stands at a cage door. Caesar sprints for it, as fo salvation-but AS SOON AS HE CROSSES THE THRESHOLD, HE REALIZES IT'S A DEAD END. He turns, but DODGE SHUTS THE DOOR IN HIS FACE AND LOCKS CAESAR FINDS HIMSELF TRAPPED IN A 10' BY 10' CAGE. DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid monkey.

dialogues.speaker: THE BETRAYAL.
dialogues.text: Then he begins frantically grabbing at the bars, jumping the ceiling, searching for a way out. To his left: the faces of THREE HUGE, AGITATED CHIMPANZEE pound the concrete floor, YELLING at him. To his right: THREE MORE CHIMPANZEES. Caesar lets out a PRIMAL, BLOOD-CURDLING SCREAM. WE FOLLO THE SCREAM as it spreads out over the property...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .and finds the Will's car, driving down the winding road, away from the Ranch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will keeps driving, TEARS streaming down his face. 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time has passed. Long shadows of late afternoon. Caesar sits on a bed of twigs and straw in a corner of th cage, heavy head resting on his arms. He slowly becomes conscious of a RHYTHMIC SCRAPING NOISE, followed by a LOUD BANG. He looks up. In the cage next door, Caesar sees a strapping, MUSCULAR

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS HIS NOSE, PAST HIS MOUTH AND CHIN.
dialogues.text: This is ROCKET. He shoves a PLASTIC 'PLAY REFRIGERATOR' across the cage floor... then SLAMS IT AGAINST THE WALL. He repeats this movement over and over - all the time wit challenging eye to Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAPE AGAINST CONCRETE... BAM
dialogues.text: A terrifying display of power and dominance.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, assholes. Dinner time. Rocket - slowly and deliberately, with a last threatening look to Caesar - moves off. Caesar crawls to the edge of his cage and peers out. Dodge and another animal wrangler, RODNEY, move from cage cage, SHOVELING PRIMATE CHOW INTO TROUGHS. Rodney tosses an occasional rotted vegetable. The APES enthusiastically receive the food. Dodge shovels food into Caesar's trough. Caesar stares down at the wet- looking dog food. DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm mmm. Grade A primate chow. Bet you don't get none of that in the suburbs. Caesar reaches into the disgusting goop and THROWS A HAND IN DODGE'S FACE. The apes SCREAM with LAUGHTER. Rodney looks away so Dodge doesn't see him laughing too.
DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think that's funny? That funny to you, you hairy prick? Caesar stares at Dodge... then SHOOTS HIM THE FINGER. RODNEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that! Infuriated, Dodge grabs a hose, drags it to Caesar's cage DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing you can count on: Long as there are humans on this earth, you'll always be a monkey in a cage. The BURST from the HOSE sends Caesar flying backwards. Pinned into a corner, he curls himself into a ball, using back as a shield. The water BLAST is relentless. Eventually, Dodge turns the water off. The two men take a long look at Caesar. He's left battered and soaked on the floor. RODNEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about his clothes? Might cause problems with the other apes. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's frail hand runs along the cold rail of Caesar's swing set. Empty. Useless in the back yard. The Aide stands nearby, sending a text message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks terrible. He's unshaven, pale, drawn. He sits the sofa, surrounded by reminders of Caesar - puzzles, ga etc. The newspaper's unread beside him.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: John? Walter enters, looks at Will. 9
WALTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John - where's Caesar? The old man looks stricken. WALTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we look for him? Isn't there something we can do? Will looks up at his father. He's just had an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE FOLLOW Will as he strides purposefully into the cafete He's shaved, pulled himself together. Will spots Jacobs,'lunching with his Blackberry, in a cor He heads for him. Jacobs looks up, sees will coming. Will slides into the seat across from him. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been gone a week. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was sick. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too sick to return my calls? You know it was a funny thing, but I was watching the news and they started talking about a seven-year- old chimpanzee that went nuts - and all of a sudden, there you were on the TV. A seven year old chimp, raised since birth. The cafeteria gets a little awkward as Jacobs raises his voice. Neither man cares. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the son of chimp 4. And he's smart. Off-the-charts smart. Because of the 112. The genetic therapy was passed in utero - from the mother to the son. Without a single negative side-effect. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aside from biting off a man's finger.
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was protecting my father. The same way his mother was protecting him. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had this conversation already. We knew the 112 was making the apes smart - WILL (INTERRUPTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried the 112 on my father. A conversation stopper. Jacobs is stunned. That's the effect Will was after. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a sample vial. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind. Like a chess player, Will lets the unasked question sit there. And Jacobs is undeniably, voraciously curious. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to know if it worked? Jacobs can't resist... JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was miraculous. Unquestionable adult neurogenesis - development of fresh nerve tissue. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It brought my father back. But Jacobs is confused. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me he was failing. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just like with the mice. Alzheimer's is a progressive disease, you need to keep it at bay ГўВЂВў - you need boosters.
Will can see Jacobs turning this over in his mind - the possibilities. The money. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why have you waited so long to tell me this? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't risk losing him. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Him'? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ape? Jacobs looks at his old friend, wondering about his sanit WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've discovered a safe treatment. It's the payday you've been waiting for. I'll recreate the primate version of 112 for you. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But only under one condition. It takes Jacobs a moment before he gets outraged. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're giving me conditions? I could have you arrested for what you've done. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you won't - you need me to build the drug. Here's what I need: I want you to get Caesar back. JACOBS (THROWN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell can I do that? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However they do things in your part of the world. Get attorneys into it. Write checks. Slip cash into the right pockets. (pausing for emphasis) Make it happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early morning sun through the tiny window of Caesar's cag He wakes shivering with cold. Notices that the other cage are empty - that his cage door is open. Tentatively, he makes his way into the common area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar looks around. No chimps. The hose lies on the wet floor, along with the detritus of feeding time. He can HEAR the APES in the distance. Caesar tries the GATE/DOOR to the outside. LOCKED. He pauses, then makes his way toward the BRIDGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar walks across the bridge. To his left, (connecting the bridge) he sees TWO MORE APE HOUSES CONNECTING TO THE BRIDGE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ORANGUTAN HOUSE - which is empty. And THE GORILLA HOUSE, which houses only one lone gorilla BUCK, who stares out at Caesar. Caesar registers THE FACT THAT BUCK'S NOT OUT WITH THE OTHER APES. Then he moves on toward the atrium. The APES are visible inside. CAESAR GETS HIS FIRST GOOD L Over two dozen CHIMPANZEES and three ORANGUTANS roam arou the atrium. The groups don't mix - chimps hang with chimp orangutans with orangutans. They haven't noticed him yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar enters, heads for the tree. One by one, the apes t notice. They STOP AND STARE at this new arrival - DRESSED LIKE A HUMAN.

dialogues.speaker: MORE UPRIGHT...
dialogues.text: Caesar looks around, finds THIRTY PAIRS OF APE EYES ON HI Should he continue to the tree? Go back to the cage?

He spots a BALL across the way. Moves to it - the eyes follow him. He picks it up. The eyes wait. Caesar rolls the ball to a nearby chimp. It receives the ball, gives Caesar nothing - no smile, no connection - th tosses it to Rocket. Eyes on Caesar, Rocket discards the ball like a piece of trash. His look is insolent, an unmistakable challenge.

dialogues.speaker: SWINGS OVER A COUPLE OF BARS AND LANDS IN FRONT OF HIM.
dialogues.text: Caesar tries to walk around. Rocket blocks his path, reac out and pulls at Caesar's sleeve, as if to examine the material. Caesar jerks his arm away. Rocket bares his teeth, raises his arms. Caesar considers the options - should he run? Before he c make a move, Rocket GRUNTS, grabs his shirt at the chest. Caesar tries to push Rocket away, but the larger chimp th Caesar to the ground, pinning him. Caesar struggles to get away, accidentally SLAPPING Rocke across the face. OUTRAGED, Rocket SLAMS his hand on Caesar's chest and sta POUNDING him. Caesar tries to block the blows, but they'r coming hard and fast: his head, his stomach, his chest. Apes SHRIEK, jump up and down, egging Rocket on. Caesar manages to break loose, crawling away. Rocket grab at his shirt, drags Caesar closer. He opens his mouth wide, moving sharp teeth toward Caesar face. Caesar struggles, barely holds him off - and... .ROCKET BITES HIS ARM. BLOOD SPURTS. BAM! A SHOT RINGS OUT. Chimps scatter. Stunned, Rocket spins around - HIS MOUTH FULL OF CAESAR'S

dialogues.speaker: BLOOD
dialogues.text: pulls a TRANQUILIZING DART from his shoulder. Caesar starts to move off -
Caesar rolls over to look up... as Rocket topples onto hi Out cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar lies on a medical table, NECK AND LEFT ARM BANDAGE His shirt's ripped, and he's still wearing the khaki pant now filthy and torn. TIGHT STRAPS RUN ACROSS HIS CHEST, PINNING HIM TO THE TABLE. It's a small room furnished with meagre medical equipment Rocket's across the way, unconscious but breathing, restrained to a medical table. Caesar opens his eyes. Takes a moment to get his bearings VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar. Stewart stands over him. The light shines'behind her head STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember me? I'm Dr. Stewart. She hands him a cup of water with a straw. STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink. Caesar doesn't want the water. He signs. She clearly doesn't understand. He signs again. STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Caesar's desperate. He opens his mouth, makes a LONG, LOW SOUND. She's taken aback - is he trying to speak? STEWART (CONT-D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you show me? Show me what you need. Caesar pulls at the restraints. STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take those off. Caesar sags with defeat, overcome with DESPAIR. 0
STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry this has happened, Caesar. So sorry. Stewart stares at him. Moved at the complexity of his emotion, the obvious intelligence behind his pain. STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here once a week. I'll do my best to look after you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge pulls heavy bags of Primate Chow from a truck, stac them in a SHED. He spots Stewart striding towards him, an Ducks out of sight, vainly brushing back his hair.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What were you thinking? DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oh, hey Doc. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That chimp needs protection. Dodge's face falls. STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could've gotten him killed. DODGE (A LIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Rodney not to open his cage. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you see how sensitive he is? How intelligent? DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no, he's a real smart dresser. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him moved to the orangutan house. He'll be safe there until we re-introduce him to the group. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, since when do volunteer animal doctors make the rules around here?
STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Just do it. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, doc. Dodge returns to stacking the chow. DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one with the college education.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spinning machine, test tubes, a giant propagation tank. Empty canisters labeled ADENOVIRUS 113. REVEAL WILL in the doorway, watching it all very carefull A VIRUS TECHNICIAN approaches him. He's tentative, nervou VIRUS TECHNICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Rodman - I think there's been a mistake. Will's been waiting for this observation - he's surprised took so long to come up.

dialogues.speaker: VIRUS TECHNICIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've double-checked the replication rate of the 113 - and it's enormously fast compared to the 112. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why we're using it. We need the drug quickly. VIRUS TECHNICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... isn't it risky? I mean, at this rate of propagation, we greatly increase the possibility of mutations that are out of our control. It's a highly unstable - WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your concern - but it's going to be fine. We plan on taking precautions. The Technician pauses, not entirely satisfied. But Will's look tells him the conversation is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large truck backs onto a loading dock. Will watches as NEW GROUP OF CHIMPANZEES are unloaded from the truck and brought into the lab.
