dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's in his sweats, working. DOORBELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will opens the door to FIND STEWART STANDING THERE. For a moment he's too shocked to say anything. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to drop in on you like this. The clinic at the zoo gave me your address but they didn't have a phone number - WILL (RECOVERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. You want to come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand awkwardly by the door. She looks great. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I - you want a cup of coffee or something? STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - thanks. I just wanted to let you know that I've seen Caesar. Seen Caesar? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I volunteer once a week at The Ranch. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he alright? She hesitates, wanting to be honest but not alarming.
STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He had a rough start, but things should get smoother from now on... In the other room, Walter and his Aide become visible. Wi follows Stewart's curious gaze. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my dad. He's not doing too well. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, Caesar's going to be okay. I'm looking after him. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... I appreciate that. Awkward beat. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. If you give me your number I'll let you know from time to time how things are going - WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's grab a drink. Takes her by surprise. Maybe takes him by surprise too. She's happy he asked. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nighttime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A repulsive bowl of primate chow. Caesar - bandaged, beat and miserable - picks at it. In the next cage, the orangutans sleep. ROCK AND ROLL MUSIC. Dodge and Rodney drive up in a truck windows down, radio blaring. Dodge gets out, cigarette in his mouth, and moves drunkenly to the storage shed. 40 He emerges with two BEERS, throws one to Rodney.
Caesar watches as Dodge offers a beer can to a chimpanzee DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want a beer? The chimp reaches but Dodge pulls it away. DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a little taste of beer... He unzips his fly and PISSES INTO THE CHIMP'S FEEDING TRO Caesar watches, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: A LEVER THROWN OPEN.
dialogues.text: Caesar watches as Dodge opens all the chimpanzee house ca in succession. Rodney moves to the orangutan house. CAESAR PAYS CLOSE ATTENTION TO THE LOCK AS IT SLIDES OPEN. DODGE & RODNEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it! Let's go! Dodge and Rodney herd the apes from their cages, brandish ELECTRIC CATTLE PRODS. The primates rouse themselves, mov across the bridge. On his way out, an orangutan, MAURICE - WISE COUNTENANCE, ORANGE AND WHITE BEARD - takes a moment to check Caesar o then moves off to join the others. Caesar maneuvers to get a better view. Rocket walks, king-like, among the apes. Caesar watches h push a smaller MALE aside. The Male defers, extending his arm forward, palm up, supplicating. ROCKET CASUALLY RUNS HAND, PALM DOWN, OVER THE OUTSTRETCHED ONE. Rocket's the cock of the walk - the ALPHA MALE. Caesar shifts his attention to the GORILLA, Buck - still alone in his cage, staring through the bars, miserable. Why doesn't the gorilla ever get to go out? Then something across the ranch catches Caesar's eye: WIL CAR'S DRIVING UP TO THE OFFICE.
His heart skips a beat. He moves to the bars, barely able contain his excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will waits at a picnic table as Dodge approaches with Cae on a leash. He's immediately struck by Caesar's injured appearance, but he plasters a smile on his face. Caesar's clearly thrilled to see him. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are! I heard what happened. CAESAR (SIGNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home now. Caesar home. He tugs Will away from Dodge. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to get you out of here, but not today. I'm working on it. Caesar's face falls. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon. I promise. Will notices Dodge's ELECTRIC CATTLE PROD. CAESAR (SIGNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home. Still a question, a flicker of hope. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kills him to say it) Not yet. I can't yet. Caesar realizes: Will's going to leave him here. First incredulous - then outraged - Caesar turns away and starts walking back to his cage. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second - Caesar, where are you going? ГўВЂВў Caesar doesn't respond, doesn't turn, just keeps w Dodge catches up with him.
DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud enough for Will) No place like home, huh monkey boy? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar - come back here! He watches Caesar's retreating back, Dodge trotting along him. Realizes Caesar's nearly breaking into a run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge locks Caesar in his cell. Then moves around to the.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .storage shed. He notices Will's car still parked in fron of the office... just as - BAM! WILL DECKS HIM WITH A FIST TO THE FACE. Dodge hits t ground. Will stands over him, too livid to realize he might've just broken his hand. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch. Dodge scrabbles to his feet, wipes the blood from his nos DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was not a smart thing to do. Dodge is clearly much tougher, stronger than Will, but Wi too angry to care. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I find out Caesar's been hurt, if he's mistreated in any way, I swear I'll have you brought up on charges. Dodge looks towards Landon's house, restrains himself. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wild-eyed chimp isn't yours any more. He's mine now. The truth of the statement is worse than any punch. DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're on private property. Now get the hell out of here.
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget jail. I'll come back and kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bag of CHIPS AHOY COOKIES. Caesar - looking morose - watches as Rodney pops a cookie in his mouth and stuffs t bag into the shed...

dialogues.speaker: STEWART, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Morning Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slides open. Stewart enters, followed by Dodge. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your arm? Mind if I take a look? Stewart rummages in her MEDICAL BAG. CAESAR WATCHES AS SH PULLS OUT A PAIR OF SCISSORS, cuts off his bandages. STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking good... Caesar makes eye contact with Dodge over Stewart's should She pulls a harness from her bag. STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking him out. Thought I'd cheer him up, show him the horses. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. As she walks to Dodge, CAESAR GLANCES INTO HER MEDICAL BA STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? Use a cattle prod on me? DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're into that kind of thing. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm safer with him than I am with you. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer's no.
Stewart turns to Caesar, who's retreated onto a bed of st STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take you. (glancing at Dodge) Maybe another time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAIN. The apes sleep. Except for Caesar. Standing in the corner of his cage, Caesar pulls STEWART' SCISSORS and a roll of MEDICAL TAPE out from the STRAW. He kneels at his bedding, gathering sticks and straw. The he begins weaving the tape through several sticks, bindin them and extending them end to end. Caesar pauses, sensing something. He looks over his shoulder, discovers MAURICE THE ORANGUTAN watching him. They hold each others' gaze, Caesar taking his measure. T Caesar puts a finger to his lips. "Shhhh." Maurice makes no movement, but the agreement is clear. Caesar returns to crafting the tool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark FORMS in cages, illuminated by GREEN FLUORESCENT LIG The DOOR OPENS. EYES OPEN, HEADS TURN. Will enters - WE SEE THAT HIS HAND HIS BANDAGED. The apes watch as he walks along the cages, eyes searchin the dark chimpanzee faces.

dialogues.speaker: BAND.
dialogues.text: WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one of you wants chocolate... Chimpanzees stare back at him, giving him nothing. NOISE FROM BEHIND. Will turns. Down the row, A CHIMPANZEE ARM EXTENDS FROM A CAGE, PALM UP - WITH A RED BAND. Will walks to the cage, chimp #11, reads the label beside WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Koba."
He peers inside. Koba stares back, EYES MURKY AND SMALL

dialogues.speaker: STREAKS DOWN EACH CHEEK. A SINISTER FACE.
dialogues.text: He DROPS AN M&M INTO KOBA'S PALM. Eyes on Will, Koba it to a "storage spot" inside the cage. Then he puts out his hand again.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Nanotherapy, beta version: Male Test Subject Number eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koba doesn't resist as Will straps him to the table. He watches as a HANDLER -- EVANS - moves into the next ro opens a refrigerator with a strange BIOHAZARD SYMBOL and pulls out CANISTER labeled ADENOVIRUS 113. Evans and Will each slip on HAZMAT masks, making sure the secure. Then Evans hands the 113 to Will. All of this avidly taken in by Koba's dark eyes. Will inserts the adenovirus 113 nozzle into a plastic oxy mask. Koba's eyes are on him as he brings the mask toward the chimp's face. EVANS (THROUGH MASK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, he's a calm one, isn't he? Will tilts the nozzle, releasing a BLAST OF AEROSOL MIST KOBA'S NOSE AND MOUTH. THE CHIMPANZEE CONVULSES ON THE TABLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHOP STICKS digging into take-out Chinese. Stewart and Wi sit in her kitchen, eating. It's clear from their state o dress (or undress) that they've been intimate. Because his hand is still bandaged, he's having a hard ti with the chopsticks. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You actually punched him?
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. She thinks it's funny. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been wanting to do that since the day I met him. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't advise it. My hand's killing me. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Let me help you out. She begins feeding him the Chinese food. He puts down his chopsticks. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to get him out of there. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you are. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm going to get my dad back too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar tapes sticks together. WE SEE that he's created a THREE-FOOT LONG "ARM". He tapes the scissors firmly to it end, finger holes sticking out. Finished. Silently he moves to the edge of the cage. USING THE CONTRAPTION, HE LOOPS THE FINGER HOLES OVER THE LATCH. He tries once. Misses. Twice. Misses again. Caesar keeps trying... until finally the loop's in place. Then he begins to tug. Tug. Tug. CLICK - the LATCH OPENS. He glances over to Maurice, who silently watches. Caesar pushes open the cage door. MAURICE'S EYES FOLLOW H INTO THE NIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar walks across the bridge. He passes the entrance to the chimpanzee house - and keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He arrives at the Gorilla House. Buck's visible in his cage, asleep on a bed of straw. Cae unlocks the door latch and opens the cage door. He waits, but Buck doesn't budge. He's still fast asleep. Caesar hesitates. Then he slowly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .enters the cage, edging up to the sleeping gorilla. From this vantage point, Buck looks enormous, his vast ch rising and falling with sleep. Caesar very carefully wigg his toe. There's a GRUNT and a WHIRL OF BLACK FURRY MOVEMENT. Caes finds himself staring into the huge, angry gorilla face. Caesar - nervous - beckons toward the open door. Buck understands but can't believe it. For a moment he doesn't move. Caesar makes the gesture again -- "Come on, let's go." Before he can finish, Buck bursts past him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .across the bridge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .and into the atrium. Caesar follows. The full moon shines down on Buck, the tree, the climbing structure. The gorilla feels his feet on the grass, savoring every s Then he begins to run. He runs as fast as he can, all the way across the atrium, then all the way back. Back and forth, GORILLA WIND SPRINTS of freedom. Caesar stands back, silently watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A morning like any other. Dodge goes through his routine: 0 opening the door, wheeling out a wheelbarrow.
He makes his way to the ape houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge and his wheelbarrow approach the Gorilla House. Clo and closer to the cage... until they're right in front. The CAGE DOOR'S CLOSED, BUCK INSIDE. Dodge shovels primat chow into the gorilla's trough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar senses something: Maurice is staring at him. Caesa beginning to wonder what Maurice wants when the ORANGUTAN DOES SOMETHING REMARKABLE: HE USES SIGN LANGUAGE. MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy gorilla. Caesar's shocked. MAURICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signing orangutan. MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice circus orangutan. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More ape sign? MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Maurice alone. They HEAR DODGE'S WHEELBARROW APPROACH. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. Stupid human no like smart ape. Dodge begins shoveling primate chow into the troughs. Maurice and Caesar stop signing and blend in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket sleeps. Pieces of primate chow hit him in the head He wakes with a start. SEES THAT HIS CAGE DOOR IS OPEN.

Rocket gets to his feet, sees CAESAR STANDING IN THE COMM AREA. Rocket GRUNTS and sprints after him - through the chimpan common area - toward the door - Where WHAM! CAESAR WHACKS HIM IN THE HEAD WITH ROCKET'S PLASTIC REFRIGERATOR.

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: Buck raises his arms and SLAMS them down with a MIGHTY RO Caesar slings the plastic refrigerator aside, sending it SKITTERING across the CONCRETE. The chimpanzees, awake now, watch to see what will happen Rocket looks from Buck to Caesar. He's beaten.

dialogues.speaker: OVER ROCKET'S, SEALING HIS DOMINATION.
dialogues.text: A COLLECTIVE GASP OF AWE moves through the ho-use. Rocket crawls back to his cage, defeated. Caesar - walkin at full height - follows. He CLOSES ROCKET'S CAGE DOOR AN LOCKS HIM IN. Then Caesar walks upright around the cages once more, mak eye contact with each and every chimpanzee. He exits with his Lieutenant, Buck, in tow. CHIMPANZEE HOUSE HAS A NEW ALPHA MALE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Evans (the handler) are wearing hazmat masks as administer Adenovirus 113 to chimp after chimp. Chimp after chimp convulses on the table. They lead Koba to the table. Koba knows what to do. He li down, allows himself to be strapped in. All routine. Everyone's guard is down. But as soon as the BLAST OF AEROSOL MIST is released, KOB ГўВЂВў THRASHES OUT AN ARM, HITTING EVANS IN THE SIDE OF
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold him steady! Evans tightens the straps on Koba's flailing arm. WE SEE THAT EVANS' MASK HAS BEEN KNOCKED ASKEW. Will finishes administering the drug. Koba goes limp on t table. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay Evans? EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will demonstrates the "Tower of Hanoi" puzzle. Koba watch WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't put larger blocks on top of smaller ones. (pointing to right side) Move the stack from here to here. Koba takes the puzzle and ROTATES IT 180 DEGREES CLOCKWIS SO THAT THE LEFT STACK IS INDEED NOW ON THE RIGHT SIDE. Will looks at Koba. Koba looks back. WILL (CONT'D) (DEMONSTRATING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to take the blocks off and stack them again, like this. Will turns the puzzle back around. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see you try. Koba puts out a palm - asking for an M&M. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you an M&M if you can get the blocks to the other side - but don't do it the way you did last time. Koba thinks, then ROTATES THE PUZZLE AGAIN - THIS TIME COUNTERCLOCKWISE. Ingenious in its own way.
WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I want. You're just not going to give it to me. Koba puts out a palm. There's A LOOK IN HIS EYE, MALEVOLE DISQUIETING.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What do you think of Koba?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look through cage bars at Will and Franklin, who stand away, across the room. FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna know if I think the 113's making him nuts. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he's smart. But there's something else, something worrisome. He challenges me. Taunts me. Will looks toward us, toward the bars. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) I don't want to try it on... (CATCHES HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .I don't want to start human trials if there's any chance of danger. FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you're seeing has nothing to do with the 113, Doc. The apes're just like us - they're complex. Some are loyal, some are selfish, some have a good sense of humor. And some are born rotten. Koba moves into frame. We've been watching from his point view, from inside the cage. Now we look over his shoulder, where the sharp planes of ГўВЂВў face frame the two men across the room.
FRANKLIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's a bad apple, that's all. A chill runs down Will's spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car pulls up to the gate. Evans is driving. He looks il GUARD (OPENING GATE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early day today, Evans? EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually I'm not feeling too good. EVANS GETS A SHIVER. GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what: Whiskey, lemon, honey and a cup of hot water. Never fails. EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks - I'm on it. Evans drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stewart sits atop one of the ranch horses, looking down a the chimpanzee area. She watches CAESAR walking across the bridge. Caesar move easily among the apes, his Alpha Male status clear as the others make way for him. Stewart's relieved - and a little surprised - to see Caes so at ease with the other apes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROCKET'S MISERABLE. Dodge and Rodney watch him through th bars. RODNEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still won't eat, won't come out. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can fix that. Dodge drags the hose to Rocket's cage.
DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that monkey ass out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar watches Dodge BLAST Rocket with WATER. Rocket does struggle, doesn't fight back. The harsh jet pelts his bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket sleeps. The FEEDER BIN OPENS AND SHUTS, waking him Tentatively, Rocket peers inside the bin: A COOKIE. Never seen a cookie before. Rocket picks it up. Smells it. Take a taste. Wow. He gobbles it down. At that moment Rocket's CAGE DOOR OPENS. Caesar stands holding a LARGE BAG OF CHIPS AHOY. He tosse cookie to Rocket. Beckons him out of the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket exits warily, on his guard for anything... But Caesar simply stands with the cookie bag. No gorilla. No shovel. He hands the cookie bag to Rocket. Rocket watches - confused - as CAESAR PULLS THE MAIN LEVE OPENING ALL THE CAGES AT ONCE. CHIMPS EMERGE, bewildered. Rocket stands with the cookie bag, unsure what to do. Cae makes a motion with his hand. Now Rocket understands. He gives a cookie to the nearest chimp. Then another one. Then another. The chimps go crazy for the cookies. THEY GATHER AROUND

dialogues.speaker: MOMENT
dialogues.text: Now Caesar opens the orangutan and gorilla cages. A momen of discomfort as Caesar leads the other apes in. Caesar pulls an orangutan over to Rocket. Rocket hands th orangutan a cookie. The other orangutans and Buck immediately line up. Discomfort's gone - now it's one big ГўВЂВў party.
Caesar watches, satisfied, as the apes feast together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar sits high in the tree, looking down at the apes. Rocket's part of the group again, but no longer the Alpha Caesar's got his eye on CORNELIA, a FEMALE APE, standing a group of females. He follows her movements with his eyes... Maurice climbs up next to Caesar. MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why cookie Rocket? CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need strong. All apes strong. MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No understand. Caesar grabs a small twig off the tree and BREAKS IT. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorilla. He breaks another twig. CAESAR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orangutan. He breaks another. CAESAR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chimpanzee. He grabs a bunch of twigs and holds them together - now t can't be broken. CAESAR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot. A beautiful morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's getting ready for his day. Hair wet from the showe buttoning up his shirt, he pauses to pour himself a cup o coffee, look up at the clock.
He takes a sip, heads down the hall to his father's room. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's sleeping late today - Will opens the door - and FREEZES IN HIS TRACKS. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG SHOT of Will sitting at a gravesite service, surroun by twenty-odd PEOPLE. WE RECOGNIZE Stewart, Jacobs, one o the Aides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will waits at the picnic table. He's been there a while. Finally Rodney appears. RODNEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry - can't get him to come out. He won't budge. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows I'm here? RODNEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him. Will brushes by Rodney, heads for the cages. RODNEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - you are not allowed back THERE -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will ignores him, keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar sees Will coming. He turns his back, heads to a common area away from the bars. Will runs up to the cage. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar - please! I've got something to tell you - (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about Walter. Г‚ВЂВў
WE FIND CAESAR deep out of sight in the orangutan cage. H heard Will's words. Will waits. Caesar's not coming out.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: NASA has temporarily lost communication with the Icarus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sits with a glass of Scotch, watching TV. Stewart's looking at a FRAMED PHOTOGRAPH. NEWSCASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Taylor and his crew are navigating the ship around the dark side of Mars. Communication is expected to be reestablished - WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was too late. She puts the photo down, cuddles against him. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tried. You worked really hard. Walter knew that. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't good enough though, was it. ANGLE ON THE PHOTOGRAPH. It shows a younger Walter and hi two teenage sons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franklin's on the phone. FRANKLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just checking in. You didn't show up at work today. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crummy little place. TV's on with no sound. WE HEAR FRANKLIN'S VOICE through the phone machine.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hope you're feeling better - let me know if you need anything.
REVEAL EVANS, LYING IN BED, DEAD - a streak of brown drie blood across his cheek -- as if draining from his lifeles eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep night at the ranch. A moon half-hidden by clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar uses his contraption to get out of the cage. Mauri grabs his arm. MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where go? CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar slips out of the orangutan house, heads toward the GATE. As he passes the chimpanzee house HE HEARS A CHIMPANZEE C OUT. He turns. Finds Rocket staring out at him, wanting t go with him. Caesar hesitates. Rocket CALLS OUT LOUDER. To quiet him, Caesar walks over to Rocket's cage, but as gets closer, he sees something that gives him pause: ROCK EYES HAVE CHANGED. Caesar gets right up against the bars of Rocket's cage, t Rocket's face in his hands and looks into his eyes: THEY UNMISTAKABLY GREEN. Reeling, Caesar tries to make sense of this. And then he remembers the bite. Rocket bit him. He looks down at the wound on his arm, now nearly healed. Has Caesar's blood changed Rocket? Caesar opens Rocket's'cage. The chimp emerges, ready for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar and Rocket barrel across the ranch, past the livin ГўВЂВў quarters, past the barn, onto the winding road lea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Middle of the night, only a few cars. Caesar and Rocket stick to bushes and shadows. They wait a break in traffic, cross the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance the LIGHTS of the TOWN give a glow to the night sky. Caesar and Rocket gallop toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, quiet. RUSTLING IN THE TREES, as if a storm is comi

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY CAESAR BURSTS THROUGH, SWINGING FOR THE NEXT TRE
dialogues.text: A moment later ROCKET FOLLOWS. Swinging from tree to tree, they make their way down the suburban street.

dialogues.speaker: CREAK, CREAK... CREAK, CREAK.
dialogues.text: WILL'S WAKENED by the NOISE. What is that? CREAK, CREAK. . .CREAK, CREAK. It's coming from outside. REVEAL STEWART asleep next to Will. He gets out of bed, moves to the window, looks into the back yard. THE SWING MOVES BACK AND FORTH, AS IF RECENTLY OCCUPIED. Will scans the grounds - no movement, nothing to see. Satisfied, he climbs back in bed and closes his eyes. THAT'S WHEN A SHADOW PASSES OVER THE BED. It's CAESAR'S SILHOUETTE, noiselessly emerging from the darkness. He stands there, looking down at Will and Stewart. His face is impossible to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket's fascinated by photos of Caesar with Will and Wal along the mantle. Caesar emerges from Will's room and makes his way down th hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stripped bed, a couple of packed boxes. Caesar stands at doorway, taking it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feet pounding the pavement, Caesar and Rocket head away f Will's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEN-SYS RESEARCH SIGN. The grounds are deserted. A SECURI GUARD listens to RADIO in the guard kiosk. Caesar and Rocket - eyes on the Security Guard - stop at spot hidden by a tree and scale the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar and Rocket drop down to the grass. They SNIFF THE AIR, head toward the Primate House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Guard yawns, checks his watch. Over his shoulder, on a monitor, WE SEE the dark forms of two chimpanzees run across the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar and Rocket arrive at the Primate House. Caesar tri the big double door - locked. He looks upward, spies a RO OF AWNING WINDOWS near the roof. Rocket pushes a dumpster close to the building wall. Then Caesar jumps on the dumpster and catapults himself t the window's ledge. Hanging by one arm, he swings himself through the window. Rocket follows. 0

dialogues.speaker: INT. PRIMATE HOUSE/OFFICE NIGHT
dialogues.text: Franklin's got the graveyard shift. He's watching a movie the office computer - doesn't hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eerie, darkly lit. SLEEPING CHIMPS stir. CAESAR and ROCKE drop to the cement floor. Now they have a clear view of the cramped cages, DARKENED FIGURES INSIDE. Caesar walks alongside them, peering into each one, studying the shadowy, simian faces.

dialogues.speaker: BAND AROUND ITS WRIST.
dialogues.text: IT'S OFFERING AN M&M. Caesar approaches the cage... FINDS HIMSELF FACE TO FACE KOBA. HIS EYES ARE BEADY, A STEELY GREY.

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING IN THE OTHER, BUT NEITHER KNOWS WHAT IT IS.
dialogues.text: Caesar moves on. HE'S INTENT, LOOKING FOR SOMEONE. Rocket barrels forward, grabs the M&M from Koba's han Koba offers up ANOTHER M&M. But ROCKET'S EYES ARE ON IDENTIFICATION BAND - THAT'S WHAT HE WANTS.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET CONSIDERS A MOMENT, THEN MOVES TO THE LATCH.
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Caesar. He's nearly reached the last of the cages, and the DISAPPOINTMENT IS PLAIN ON HIS FACE. These chimpanzees are distant, strange. No familiar face. NO CONNECTION. Caesar reaches the last cage, where A YOUNG CHIMP, sick, stares back at him. Caesar turns away, crestfallen.
He YELLS for ROCKET, and the two of them take off. The LA CHIMPS start to SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEARING THE COMMOTION, Franklin puts down his book, heads

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .into the Primate House. Where he stops in his tracks. KOBA STANDS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROOM, UPRIGHT. They stare at each other. Then Koba LEAPS FOR HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar and Rocket head for the fence. A GUARD approaches his nightly rounds. They look at each other, lay low. To protect Caesar, Rocket takes off running. The SHOCKED

dialogues.speaker: TALKIE.
dialogues.text: But Rocket's too fast - in a moment he's out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar's waiting when Rocket runs up. They take off together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar and Rocket enter. That's when WE NOTICE: CAESAR'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar opens Rocket's cage. As soon as the door closes behind him, the huge chimp collapses, exhausted. Caesar walks around the chimpanzee house, images of the n swirling through his head. Around him, the chimps sleep, oblivious. Except for CORNELIA - she's wide awake. Staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apes have calmed down. Koba slips back into his cage ГўВЂВў closes the door.
CLICK. It locks into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn of a new day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight reaches through the bars and streaks across Caes face. He opens his eyes. Looks at Cornelia, still asleep. Caesar creeps toward the open entrance to her cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar emerges into the common area. The chimps are still asleep. There's a CLANKING as the OUTSIDE GATE OPENS. Caesar freezes. Dodge enters with the wheelbarrow of Primate Chow and the shovel. Locks the door behind him. He hasn't seen Caesar yet. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rise and shine, assholes. The chimps wake. One by one they notice Caesar, standing the common area. THEN DODGE SEES HIM. DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell - (seeing Cornelia's open CAGE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sly son of a bitch. How'd you do that? Dodge is careful, slow, as he picks up the shovel and hol it in front of him. He circles around the common area toward Cornelia's cage. DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna go slow here, alright? You're gonna go back in your cage, you're not going to give me no trouble.

The apes - chimps, orangutans, the gorilla - are silent, riveted, waiting to see what will happen. Cornelia stands, watching. Caesar doesn't take his eyes off Dodge, but his expressio unreadable. Dodge reaches Cornelia's cage. He VIOLENTLY BANGS THE SHO AGAINST THE BARS. DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back! Caesar reacts, a snarl curling his lips. Keeping his eyes on Caesar, sweat dripping down his templ Dodge KICKS CORNELIA'S CAGE SHUT. Now he starts moving forward, trying to back Caesar towar the orangutan cage. DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to have you fixed, Einstein, that's for damn sure... But first we're going to figure out how you pulled this off...

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR INCHES BACK, KEENLY AWARE OF EVERY APE'S EYE ON HI
dialogues.text: DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. Get in that cage. Caesar stops, refusing to go any farther. DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said get! But Caesar doesn't move. Dodge pokes the shovel at him, then SLAMS it to the cemen floor. He edges closer to Caesar, grip tightening around the sho handle. Then he rears it back, face contorted in rage. DODGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in that cage, you damn dirty ape! ГўВЂВў CAESAR'S EYES NARROW. HE STANDS TALL, STRETCHING T HEIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: TREMENDOUS EFFORT... SPEAKS.
dialogues.text: CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with his voice) No! STUNNED SILENCE. THE WORLD STOPS SPINNING. Dodge is thunderstruck - nearly loses his balance. Caesar has spoken. Actually uttered a word. Maurice, Rocket, Buck, and all the apes stare, dumbfounde trying to comprehend what has just happened. And then... they go nuts. SCREAMING. YELLING. JUMPING UP AND DOWN. That's when Caesar attacks. He rushes Dodge, wrestling the shovel from his hands. Dodge spins around to defend himself - and CAESAR HITS HI THE SIDE OF THE HEAD. Dodge staggers back. Caesar SLAMS the shovel in his stomach. Dodge crumples forward.

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR SWINGS THE SHOVEL UP, SMACKING HIM IN THE FOREHEAD
dialogues.text: Lights out. Caesar drags Dodge to Rocket's cage and opens the door. Rocket helps pull him inside.

dialogues.speaker: APES COME STREAMING OUT.
dialogues.text: They gather around Caesar, who holds up STEWART'S SCISSOR AND SLICES OPEN HIS OWN PALM. Then he walks to Rocket, who gets down on his knees and p out his hand in the supplicating gesture. CAESAR TAKES TH

He moves to Maurice, who offers up his hand. Caesar slice the palm and places his hand against it. Then he turns to Buck - who stands up tall, beats his che and YELLS... BUT THEN OFFERS UP HIS HAND. And now Caesar looks around, as EVERY APE LINES UP, THEIR OPEN PALMS WAITING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will wakes, climbs out of bed, careful not to wake Stewar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves down the hallway, approaching Walter's room. He pauses, puzzled, at the door - which is AJAR. Strange. THE PHONE STARTS TO RING. Will ignores it -- slowly pushes the door open... AND SEE CAESAR'S TATTERED PANTS LAID ACROSS THE STRIPPED BED. He stands there, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Will? Hello? Will pick up the goddamned phone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? INTERCUT WITH JACOBS AT THE LAB. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The animal handler - Franklin - was killed last night. In the primate house. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franklin's dead? JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something very powerful broke his neck. Snapped it in two. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could it have been one of our chimps?
JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All our apes are accounted for - ГўВЂВў secured in their cages. But here's the kicker: One of our security guards swears he chased a chimpanzee off the grounds last night. Will - with growing dread - looks out the window at Caesa swing. JACOBS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where in the hell did that chimp come from?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will speeds out of the driveway, Stewart by his side. She dialing her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Landon answers the RINGING PHONE. He's in his pajamas

dialogues.speaker: MR. LANDON
dialogues.text: The Ranch. Landon speaking. (LISTENING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Stewart. (LISTENING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar? Dodge fed them breakfast about half an hour ago... He holds up a PAIR OF BINOCULARS, looks toward the atrium ape houses. Can't see anything wrong.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LANDON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me call you back... He HEARS THE BACK KITCHEN DOOR OPEN. RUSTLING NOISES in t kitchen. Opening and closing of cabinets.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LANDON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey Dodge - Stewart just called - WE FOLLOW HIM out of the living-room, into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LANDON
dialogues.text: She said that -
Landon goes pale. ROCKET AND TWO OTHER CHIMPANZEES ARE STANDING IN THE KITCHEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two CHIMPANZEES drag Mr. Landon toward the Ape Houses Rocket follows, munching cereal from a box of Cheerios.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DISTANCE
dialogues.text: Rodney's visible, being dragged, SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's car speeds up to the gate and stops. STEWART (ON PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's answering. In the distance they can HEAR the PHONE RINGING at the ra house. From where the car is, nothing out of the ordinary visible. Will thinks a moment, gets out of the car. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go get help. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a way in the world. I'm coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sneak into the back of the ranch house. All is quiet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But once inside, the level of destruction is immediately visible: Overturned table and chairs, plates smashed, cupboards emptied. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... I'm calling 911.. Will picks up Landon's BINOCULARS, moves to the front win HE SEES: Debris everywhere. Apes free, wandering... DODGE LANDON and RODNEY BATTERED AND IN CAGES.
.CAESAR. CLEARLY THE ALPHA MALE. Clearly in control. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar. Will lowers the binoculars as Stewart rushes in. She's trembling. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to take them at least half an hour to get here. He begins rummaging in drawers, in cabinets. There's an empty cookie bag, but Will's able to put his hands on a couple of stray COOKIES. He has an idea. Under the sink he finds what he's looking for: RAT POISON STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill him. STEWART (HORRIFIED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dangerous. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong - he can't have been the one who killed that man - WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no other explanation. A BLACK SHADOW passes by the window. Then another. Stewar turns. Now there's another. They're surrounded. She SCREAMS. Will barricades the back door with a table. Chimpanzees at every window BANGING ON THE GLASS, wanting GLASS SHATTERS. Will and Stewart run to the front room, just as the door CRASHES OFF ITS HINGES - REVEALING BUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar! I need to talk to you! Dodge, Rodney and Landon watch as Will and Stewart are pu into the cage next door. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar! DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the mad house. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called Animal Control - they'll be here soon - WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the bars) I just want to talk to you! DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well this'll be interesting because your freak'll talk back. RODNEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge thinks he spoke to him. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did! He said the word "no" - right to my face. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can talk. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he must have a voicebox in his ass, because I heard him! Caesar walks up. Will steels himself, feels in his pocket - the POISONED COOKIE is ready. 0
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar - people are coming. People with guns. You've got to make the apes go back in their cages. CAESAR (SIGNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apes no belong in cage. Human put apes in cage. Will's heart sinks as he sees that Caesar is intransigent He means what he's saying. CAESAR (CONT'D) (SIGNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never again. Will takes a moment, DIGS DEEP TO MAKE HIMSELF DO WHAT MU BE DONE. Finally he brings the POISONED COOKIE from his pocket, ho it out. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought this for you. Caesar eyes the cookie but doesn't take it. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (it's killing him) Don't you want it? CAESAR (SIGNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. They look at each other. Two creatures once so close, but now with a vast chasm between them. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went to the lab last night. I know it was you. Caesar doesn't deny it. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotion spilling over) How could you kill that man, Caesar? Once you kill you can't it back - that man's gone forever.
It gives him pause. CAESAR (SIGNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar no kill. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... CAESAR (SIGNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar no kill! Caesar SLAPS the COOKIE from Will's hand. Rocket immediately comes over to stand by Caesar, but Cae doesn't want to fight. He's done - disgusted - with Will. He turns, begins to walk off. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't walk away. We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: THE COOKIE ON THE GROUND.
dialogues.text: WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't - ! TOO LATE - SHE GOBBLES IT UP.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND KOBA'S ARM.
dialogues.text: WILL (CONT'D) (SHOCKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd he get that wristband, Caesar? That's Koba's band... (REALIZING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Koba get out of his cage?? Yelling after Caesar. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar wait! But Caesar's not waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar climbs onto the open tailgate of a pick-up truck. ГўВЂВў Apes gather around, expectant.
CAESAR (VOICE STRAINING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. At the sound of Caesar's voice, the apes rise tall. FROM THE CHIMPANZEE HOUSE Will and Stewart watch, stunned CAESAR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C...Cage! The humans' jaws drop, petrified. CAESAR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: THE APES SHRIEK TO HEAVEN.
dialogues.text: BEAT OF JUNGLE DRUMS as CAESAR BOLTS FROM THE TRUCK BED. APES RACE TO FOLLOW HIM OFF THE RANCH. Will - and the other humans - are blown away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pack of apes, led by Caesar, emerges from the ranch g and moves out over the countryside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANIMAL CONTROL, AMBULANCE, POLICE VEHICLES stream onto th ranch. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They could be spread out all over the County by now. Will and Stewart - released from the cages - speak to OFF HUFFS. Dodge, Rodney, and Landon huddle nearby. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - they'll stick together. DODGE (INTERRUPTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're following one ape. You kill him, you stop them all. HUFFS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a leader?
DODGE (POINTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him - he raised him. All eyes to Will. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Caesar. If I can reason with him, I know I can put an end to this. HUFFS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reason with him? Huffs thinks he's nuts. He turns, starts toward his squad car. Will follows, Stewart on his heel. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand - this chimp is smart - he'll listen to me HUFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to nearby JUNIOR OFFICER) Get on the horn with every agency you can think of! We've got to track down these monkeys before they do major damage! The Junior Officer - GRANGER - heads for his car. Dodge follows. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need me riding with you. I've got experience with these animals. (eye on Will) I can point out the one you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AMBULANCE pulling away. Two POLICE CARS out front. Jacobs stands talking with a couple of POLICE OFFICERS. OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing Jacobs a card) If you think of anything else, this is where I can be reached - A RUMBLING SOUND from behind. They turn to see a RANCH APE ARMY heading their way. Shocked, they leap out of the way as best they can. Г‚ВЂВў

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apes STAMPEDE past them and SWARM INTO THE LAB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar and his chimps BURST THROUGH THE DOOR. No time is wasted. Cages are opened, LAB CHIMPS liberated Koba steps from his cage slowly, measuring the situation apes around him go crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stunned officer gets to his squad car walkie-talkie. OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a situation at Gen-Sys Laboratory! Approximately two dozen apes, gorillas, I don't know what the hell they are - AUDIBLE CHAOS from inside the lab. YELLING, SCREAMING, DESTRUCTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huffs drives - Will in the front, Stewart in back. They c hear everything through the radio. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lab. HUFFS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know anything about this? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where I work.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LAB/PRIMATE HOUSE/TREATMENT ROOMS- DAY
dialogues.text: ANARCHY OF MOVEMENT, BLURS of BLACK FUR running amok thro white rooms, tearing everything up. EMPLOYEES SCATTER - running for the exits. Some duck behi desks. ANGLE ON REFRIGERATED CANISTERS OF 113. Like everything else in the lab, torn down, stomped on, thrown against the wall. Caesar and Buck walk through the lab, eyeing the destruct

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacobs, a Security Guard and the two Officers are huddled behind a squad car. Other Employees are hiding and watchi from the safety of the parking lot. They suddenly realize that everything has GONE SILENT. A moment later, LAB DOORS FLY OPEN. OFFICER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here they come! A MASS OF PRIMATES BARREL TOWARD THEM. OFFICER #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more of them! JACOBS (REALIZING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are my chimps... They duck as the apes run by - some of them right up and the car they're crouched behind. BAM! BAM! BAM! as the chimp's hit and leapfrog over the s car - and their heads. The apes stampede across the parking lot, where several u Jacobs' BLACK JAGUAR to VAULT OVER THE FENCE. The last is BUCK, whose weight CRUSHES the car. And then they're gone. Every last one of them. Quiet now, except for CAR ALARMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacobs enters the lab. In front of him is utter silence a devastation. Like the morning after a huge, destructive party. Out of the quiet there's the PADDING SOUND OF FOOTSTEPS O BROKEN GLASS. Jacobs freezes. KOBA APPEARS from around a doorway. He and Jacobs look at each other for a long moment. Then Koba calmly walks past him. 0

Once outside Koba GALLOPS OFF. Jacobs can see him through the open doorway disappearing in the direction of the oth Jacobs takes a stumbling step backwards, KICKING SOMETHIN THAT GOES LOUDLY ROLLING ALONG THE CEMENT FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four HELICOPTERS wait. Hoff s, Will and Stewart climb int one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOFFS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea where they're headed? Will sees Dodge joining SHARPSHOOTERS in another helicopt below. He doesn't like it. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. HOFFS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were seen heading north from the lab - let's start with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hillside park overlooking San Francisco bay. THICK FOG moving in. KIDS EVERYWHERE - slides, seesaws, climbing structures. A LITTLE GIRL plays in a sandbox. Her MOTHER reads on a bench nearby. The Girl looks up, claps her hands. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monkey! OVER HER SHOULDER WE SEE A CHIMPANZEE HEADING OUR WAY. Th another. And another.

dialogues.speaker: WAY DOWN THE SLOPE.
dialogues.text: suddenly the Little Girl's not so sure. PEOPLE START TO NOTICE - GRAB THEIR KIDS. The Mother looks up from her book. SOMEONE SCREAMS.
GIRL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy? The Girl's surrounded now by moving apes --- the Mother c get to her. MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April! Suddenly Caesar doubles back from the lead. He scoops her and puts her down out of harm's way. Then he continues herding the apes forward. He knows wher he's going. SIRENS APPROACH. Squad cars give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fog rolls in off the bay. Will's strapped into his seat, looking down at the city below. HUFFS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see them? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't see - STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Seated next to Will, she draws him to her window. FAR BEL it looks like a BLACK LOCUST moving through the urban spr chased by numerous Squad Cars - directly behind them, alo parallel streets... She realizes something. STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where they're going. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: A SIGN
dialogues.text: FAMILIES. Hot dog stands and ice cream vendors. The fun is interrupted by the SOUND OF HELICOPTERS sweepi low overhead. Faces turn skyward...
A moment later, Caesar and his apes RUMBLE IN. Chaos. PEOPLE scatter. SCREAM. Released balloons float lazily upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will watches Caesar moving the apes down the zoo's pathwa dodging people, jumping over benches. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to release the apes. Looking to his left, Will sees a sniper try to get shots but hesitate. The apes are too interspersed with fleeing PATRONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the apes pass other enclosures, the ANIMALS GO NUTS. Lions ROAR. Giraffes run back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WRANGLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell am I supposed to do when they get here?! An APE WRANGLER screams into a wall phone at the Ape Enclosure. The ZOO APES are agitated and anxious - they k something's coming. Suddenly the phone is ripped from wall. The Wrangler cowe turns to see Caesar and his apes. Rocket rattles the door, bares his teeth. The Wrangler understands - fumbles for his keys. SOUND OF BOLTS AND LOCKS CLICKING OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All kinds of apes - Chimps, Orangutans, Gorillas - rush f their separate enclosures. Caesar's apes are waiting for them. Caesar makes eye contact with the GRIZZLED OLD MALE CHIMPANZEE. Then - as a unit - they all run for the exit.
By now, ALL THE ANIMALS ARE GOING CRAZY. Above, the sky is full of helicopters now -- some Police, News Crews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apes are visible streaming from the zoo and emptying onto street. DODGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him! The one with the white on his shoulder! A SNIPER takes aim at Caesar - the BULLET RICOCHETS OFF T SIDEWALK. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacobs watches a TOW TRUCK pull away with his ruined blac Jaguar in tow. He climbs into a waiting taxi. He looks like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TAXI DRIVER - a guy with a THICK MUSTACHE - turns aro to face him. TAXI DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to, my man? JACOBS HAS A SHIVER. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 Marigold. TAXI DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to turn down the air? JACOBS (DESPONDENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. HE COUGHS. CUT TO: 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apes leap over cars, run in and out of traffic. PEDESTRIA take cover. SNIPER FIRE RINGS OUT from helicopters above - an APE FAL Caesar's leading, running alongside Cornelia. She falters Caesar slows with her, concerned. SHE LOOKS ILL. But Cornelia digs deep and picks up her speed. Caesar continues on.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HELICOPTER- DAY
dialogues.text: Will's plastered to the window, anxiously watching Caesar progress. Below, the BLACK LOCUST that is the pack of apes has grow larger, but they stay together, moving implacably North through the San Francisco streets. Up ahead, the GOLDEN GATE BRIDGE COMES INTO VIEW - majest shimmering in the afternoon light. And Will realizes the moment he sees it. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to Muir Woods. (turning to Huffs) I'm sure of it. He doesn't want to hurt anyone - he's just trying to get the apes out of the City! HUFFS (INTO HEADSET)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut down the Golden Gate Bridge! WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - let them through! CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars speed across the bridge in both directions. HIGHWAY PATROLMEN rush to block the entrances.

The apes arrive at the shadow of the great bridge - a stampeding phalanx with Caesar at the lead. But Cornelia can't keep up any more. Losing her balance, stumbles, falls. Caesar rushes to Cornelia's side. By the time he reaches her, she's dead - a WHITE FOAM has formed at her lips. She's been poisoned. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK of Cornelia, sniffing the cookie. Will yelling "Don't"... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar - devastated, the rage building in his face. He looks up as one of the HELICOPTERS BUZZES LOW - HE SEE WILL. THEY MAKE EYE CONTACT. Caesar struggles to his feet with Cornelia in his arms - going to carry her across the bridge. Other helicopters BUZZ low, SHOTS RING OUT, SIRENS CLOSE Apes take cover around trees and structures, but they're getting PICKED OFF. Maurice takes Cornelia from Caesar's arms as Buck and Roc urge him forward. Koba hangs back, watching, fascinated, as Maurice lays Cornelia's body on the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's gone pale. STEWART (ALARMED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he hurt? WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two CHP PATROL CARS are frantically stopping new traffic entering the bridge and waving exiting traffic through.

Suddenly, OUT OF THE FOG, THE APES APPEAR. TRAFFIC slams to a halt. PEOPLE are STUNNED as chimps, gorillas, orangutans VAULT THEIR CARS, run down the middle of the traffic - stampedi across the bridge. Helicopters BUZZ around like flies - SHARPSHOOTERS unable get a safe shot.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE NORTH END OF THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Blocked off by CHP, all traffic stopped. A few helicopters touch down - SHARPSHOOTERS jump out, ri ready, and follow on foot behind SQUAD CARS, FOUR ACROSS, THAT SLOWLY DRIVE ACROSS THE BRIDGE - TOWARD THE APES. DODGE IS AMONG THEM.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SOUTH END OF THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Caesar and his apes race forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Stewart watch from above as the apes stream Northward, over and around stopped cars. HUFFS (INTO HEADSET)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them to hold their fire until they get past the traffic! WILL SEES below that soon Caesar and the apes will reach place on the bridge where there are no more cars. Then they'll be open season. Then HE SEES the FOUR SQUAD CARS slowly approaching from north end of the bridge, SHARPSHOOTERS - and DODGE - on f behind them.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Caesar looks ahead - realizes that he's at the end of the bridge traffic. Ahead is empty roadway. And the slowly approaching squad cars. He looks up at the helicopters, rifles at the ready.

He sees the FOG, swirling in and out of the SUSPENSION CABLES. Caesar SIGNALS TO MAURICE. Maurice glances over the bridge railing. The Bay churns a swirls hundreds of feet below. Caesar BARKS at Maurice, who then climbs over the railing taking the orangutans and a handful of chimps with him. Caesar BARKS a command at BUCK - who waits by the last ca with a PACK OF GORILLAS and some chimps. Then Caesar starts to climb. Shimmying up a cable and int the fog. Rocket's right behind. The remaining apes follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the sky Will sees Caesar divide up his army. Chimps ascend cables, disappearing in and out of patches fog. Orangutans and apes descend below the bridge deck. And Buck with his gorilla, take refuge in the stalled traffic.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Maurice finds bars and support beams. He and the below-de apes begin swinging their way toward the.north end. ABOVE BRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apes shimmying up cables appear out of the fog, arriving the MAIN CABLE - the thick one running along the top. They start scampering and swinging north, the FOG MOVING SWIRLING, CHANGING SHAPE AROUND THEM. A SHARPSHOOTER from a helicopter takes a SHOT. A CHIMP FALLS TO HIS DEATH. It's a long fall, until - SPL the chimp hits the water. They keep moving. 0

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: The FOUR PATROL CARS stop, creating a barricade. The Sharpshooters line up their rifles, ready to shoot.

dialogues.speaker: LOADS.
dialogues.text: They FIRE at the apes above them, but it's tough going - apes are in constant motion, and the fog obscures them. BULLETS can be heard RICOCHETING off cables. Another chimp falls to its death. Then a heavy patch of fog rolls in, engulfing the middle of the bridge, surrounding the barricade. Visibility's practically zero.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FOG.
dialogues.text: OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all around us! Apes swing above them, scamper by them. Movement - WHOOSH WHOOSH... DODGE - nervous - crouches low. He edges backwards, hopef of some visibility. That's when he SEES CAESAR, CLEAR AND OUT OF THE FOG, CLIMBING UP THE ASCENDING CABLES OF THE NORTH SIDE.

dialogues.speaker: WITH RELISH, DODGE READIES HIS RIFLE, AIMS AT CAESAR'S BA
dialogues.text: There's glare from a ray of sunlight that's broken throug the fog. He SHOOTS, BARELY MISSING. The bullet RICOCHETS off the m cable. ROCKET, climbing behind Caesar, looks down - SEES DODGE AIMING AGAIN. He starts swinging towards Caesar. Another shot from Dodge. This time the BULLET GRAZES CAESAR'S SHOULDER, AND CAESAR STUMBLES, STARTS TO FALL.

dialogues.speaker: UP.
dialogues.text: Then, using all his strength, ROCKET PULLS CAESAR BACK UP THE MAIN CABLE.

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: Rocket's hit in the back! He and Caesar make eye contact as ROCKET FALLS OFF THE BRIDGE, TUMBLING TO HIS DEATH. Caesar SCREAMS, looks down at Dodge, who aims again. But Dodge is diverted by a RUMBLING - like an EARTHQUAKE THE BRIDGE. The GORILLAS ARE IN MOTION. LEAD BY BUCK, THEY CHARGE TOW THE BARRICADE. Like a freight train of menacing power. Helicopters FIRE, MEN at the barricade SHOOT as they try back up. A gorilla falls... but they keep on coming. And now, climbing up from below - behind the barricade -- MAURICE AND THE ORANGUTANS join in. Their sheer numbers and power are unstoppable.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Koba hangs back. He's away from the action, but the battl waged above is audible. He creeps along toward the North end of the bridge. AERIAL VIEW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the fog lifts for a moment, WE SEE APES SWINGING ON

dialogues.speaker: APES SCAMPERING BELOW.
dialogues.text: Vanquishing the humans.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE.
dialogues.text: Terrified but refusing to run, Dodge fires, reloads, fire Г‚ВЂВў

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: again, his face red with the tension of what's to come.

dialogues.speaker: PICKS HIM UP, AND THROWS HIM OFF THE BRIDGE.
dialogues.text: Dodge's body twirls through the air -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, Stewart and Huffs watch, dumbstruck, as DODGE'S BOD HITS THE WATER. Below, the victorious ape army finishes off the battle of bridge and follows Caesar through the north exit... .disappearing into the dense park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE REINFORCEMENTS and EMERGENCY VEHICLES arrive. HELICOPTERS above. Will's helicopter has set down. He and Stewart stand near ASSEMBLING ARMY -- an amalgamation of 'human special forc Huffs and a small GROUP OF OFFICERS debate nearby. OFFICER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't gas the forest! The slightest wind would take it over to Tiburon. OFFICER #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it'll take us months to find them in there. OFFICER #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention rounding them all up. Will approaches the group. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where they are. The Officers look at him. Who the hell is this guy? Huffs - embarrassed - gestures toward Will. HUFFS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man owns one of the chimps. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The so-called "leader". Says he can reason him out.
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Caesar. I think he'll listen to me. If he comes out, the other apes will follow. Sounds pretty far-fetched. OFFICER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you know where to find this monkey? Will starts to correct him - lets it go. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. I used to bring him here. The Officers look at each other. OFFICER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a lot of options. Let's give it a try. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have to promise me - if I can get them out, you'll take them peacefully. Tranquilize them, cage them. No killing. Beat. HUFFS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Stewart stand at the edge of the woods. They're the path Caesar and Will used to take. She's terrified, trying to mask it. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is a bad idea? STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely. He thought so. STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's never going to agree to come out with you.
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Got to try, right? I owe him that much. Will kisses her. Heads off down the path. Then he pauses, turns to look at her. WILL (CONT'D) (YELLING BACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think he'll forgive me? STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't quite hear him) What? Will waves it off - never mind. Stewart watches him walk down the trail... and disappear the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will walks. FLASH OF BLACK up ahead. His pulse quickens - he follows it. CRACKLING of BRANCHES. More BLACK, swinging through the trees. Is it Caesar? Will follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will enters the clearing. He knows this place. Up ahead is the GROVE OF TREES with CANOPY that Caesar always loved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huffs stands looking at his watch. He looks up, turns to ASSEMBLED GROUP OF ARMED MEN. HUFFS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me. Stewart double-takes, sees the ARMY HEAD OFF IN WILL'S DIRECTION, GUNS READY. STEWART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on a second... (to nearest Officer) Where are they going?
Looks are exchanged. Someone grabs Stewart, who struggles with all her might. STEWART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet here. Will heads toward the Grove of Trees. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar! ... He keeps walking, almost there. A DARK FIGURE DROPS DOWN FRONT OF HIM. IT'S KOBA. Will takes a step back, fear crawling up the back of his neck. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. Koba stands up tall. Eyes Will. He takes his time - like he's enjoying every second of this... He walks towards will, bares his teeth. Suddenly CAESAR APPEARS, SLAMMING INTO KOBA, knocking him away.

dialogues.speaker: KOBA
dialogues.text: Which leaves just Will and Caesar. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humans coming. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm alone. Will pauses - there's so much he wants to say. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you an apology. CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will want Caesar dead.
WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you had killed a man. But I should have known better. Caesar's face is unreadable. Will can't tell what he's thinking. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to know that all of this is my fault. My responsibility. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you forgive me? BIRDS TAKE SUDDEN FLIGHT. Caesar's eyes shift to the path Will realizes he's been betrayed. WILL (CONT'D) (PANICKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait - no - CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will leave. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't - CAESAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will leave now. WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm staying with you. Caesar pushes him. Will staggers backwards, falls down. At that moment, HUFFS and his ARMY step into the clearing Huffs takes aim at Caesar. WILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: AT THAT SAME MOMENT APES DROP FROM THE TREES
dialogues.text: - a COUNTERATTACK. Huffs and his men are taken by surprise. SHOTS are fired, but not fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar lays Will out on the forest floor. There's a lot o blood. Will tries to speak. He looks up at Caesar. Caesar takes him in his arms, cradles him with love. Will looks into Caesar's green eyes. He relaxes. Lets go. Then the life passes out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stewart sits in the back of a locked Police Car, looking at the forest in the gathering darkness. All is quiet. The forest is vast, dark, green. Impenetrable. HONK OF A HORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunsiker - Will's neighbor - exits his house with a small rolling suitcase. He's wearing his pilot's uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunsiker enters, settles into the seat. TAXI DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to, my man? It's the Taxi Driver with the mustache - THE SAME ONE THA GAVE JACOBS A RIDE HOME. HUNSIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SFO. International terminal. TAXI DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it. The Driver COUGHS as he pulls away. Light sweat on his forehead - he doesn't look too good. 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON WHEELS TURNING. Hunsiker pulls his suitcase on wheels through the airport terminal. It's teeming with TRAVELERS. Holding on to the bannister, Hunsiker takes the escalator up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunsiker says hello to the FLIGHT STAFF and moves to the front of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunsiker shakes hands with his CO-PILOT and sits. He flic a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airplane takes off into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER VOICE
dialogues.text: As the ape search continues, a virulent flu strain has exploded in and around San Francisco, sending shock waves and panic throughout the community.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move along the ground of a clearing toward a lush cano of trees. As we get closer, we notice flashes of movement NEWSCASTER VOICE #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Authorities suspect the origin of the deadly virus might be Gen-Sys Laboratories - the same private company from which several laboratory chimpanzees escaped earlier this week - We're still fifty yards away from the trees, but we can s it's filled with apes - chimpanzees, orangutans, gorillas We keep pushing in, closer and closer to the trees. As we move past the leaves WE FIND BUCK. MAURICE. AND, SITTING APART FROM THE OTHERS... KOBA. All of them have eyes in varying shades of GREEN.
NEWSCASTER VOICE #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the death toll rapidly rises, Hospitals are desperately trying to meet the growing demand... Caesar sits alone, staring straight at us. NEWSCASTER VOICE #4 (INCREASINGLY DESPERATE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although isolated in the western region of the country, the numbers are catastrophic and quickly rising... Push in on CAESAR'S FACE. NEWSCASTER VOICE #5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Efforts to quarantine appear to have failed. The strain has been spotted as far away as Singapore and Australia... CLOSER AND CLOSER ON CAESAR'S FACE. NEWSCASTER VOICE #6 (RAGGED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casualties have reached apocalyptic levels. Authorities urge you to stay inside your homes... (LONG BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For those of you who can hear me, I say... (VOICE BREAKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God's speed and so long to you all. The NEWSCASTER'S VOICE is replaced by the WHITE NOISE OF SNOWY TELEVISION SET. CAESAR'S EYES FILL THE SCREEN.
